name: Union Brewing Company
vicinity: Suite Q, 622 South Rangeline Road, Carmel

reviews.text: Truly outstanding local craft brewing company. Indy's got some great local brewers, but these guys really get it right. Nice little location in Carmel, great beer and local guest taps... I'm so glad these guys moved into town. Love!

formatted_address: Suite Q, 622 South Rangeline Road, Carmel, Indiana, United States

name: Franconia Brewing Company

reviews.text: This place is amazing. Great tour with the owner who really knows his stuff and all you can drink beer for five dollars! Do this tour!

We went here for a private party and took a tour guided by the owner Dennis. You can tell he is very passionate about what he does and the end product shows this. Franconia is now my favorite and will be yours too after you stop by and try their brew.

Absolutely, the best beer in the world! This brewery brews German style beir with the upmost quality AND customer service. I have been on several tours and learn something new each time. The owner Dennis and his staff, not only produce the best tasting beer you can imagine....but deliver the best customer service I have ever encountered. Go on one of their tours and you will never want to drink anything but Franconia beer again...
Stop in for the tour of you can. It is worth it and the chance for the beer samples is quite the nice bonus

Franconia is an amazing beer brand. My favorites are the Dunkel and the Wheat in that order. Both are the best beers of their style that I have ever, ever had. The Saturday tour starts around 11:30am and it's only $5 if you bring your own glass or $10 and you can buy a glass there. Then unlimited refills during/after the tour and plenty of time to hang out and relax with friends. Franconia is amazing, look for it in restaurants in the area!

formatted_address: 495 McKinney Parkway, McKinney, TX, United States

name: Flynntown Brewing Company
formatted_address: 18042 Valley View Road, Eden Prairie, Minnesota, United States

name: Brewer's Coalition

reviews.text: This place replaced a much loved restaurant but has done a great job transforming the space and the menu. Pub atmosphere with great food and lots of flat screen TVs for sports fans. Casual and family friendly.

formatted_address: 344 Walnut Street, Newtonville, MA, United States

name: Black Raven Brewing Company

reviews.text: This is a fairly new brewery (only about 3 years old) but they make fabulous beer. The place has a nice laid back feel to it. The staff are all super chill and very knowledgable. You can get pizza delivered from across the street and on the busier days they usually have a food truck outside. My only complaint is that they only have one wheat beer, which is also filtered. Don't get me wrong, I've tried their whole line and it's all awesome, but sometimes I just want a good hearty Heff...

Beer wasn't anything special, and the open bag of pretzels was left on the floor next to the rubbish can, and got sneezed on by a bartender. Not very friendly. If I were you I wouldn't go out of your way to visit this brewery.
Delicious brews! Some of the most inventive specialty brews I've come across. The atmosphere is wonderful, but we wish they had a bit more in the way of food in-house and a bit more outdoor seating!
Delicious local brewery. Try the sampler with 6 beers and each extra for $1. Free pretzels, but peanuts costs extra as they come from a special roaster now.
Fantastic beer. One of only a few places I liked all of their beer. Plus you must order Flying Saucer pizza while you enjoy your beer

formatted_address: 14679 NE 95th Street, Redmond, WA, United States

name: Mac & Jack's Brewery

reviews.text: For those of you who have never tried Mac & Jack's African Amber, please give it a try as it is one of the best beers around. For those who have, but did not know that M & J makes other types of beers, you need to visit the brewery to sample their other fine beers .... and to take home a growler, or two or three. The brewery can be a little tricky to find the first time and parking is very limited, but the trip is well worth it. There is a great selection of Mac & Jack t-shirts, hats, glasses, coasters and more ...... one thing that is not usually on the shelves are the malt balls ..... be warned they are addictive. Make sure to take the tour while you are there, see how local craft & micro brews are made .... and how they are far superior to mass market brands.

This is one of, if not the best brewery to visit for a few reasons. Its a very small operation that mysteriously produce's large volumes of some of the best beer in the world. They do not pride them selves with a large fancy building in the center of town. Instead, they are off the beaten path in a small location in an industrial park by Marymoor park in Redmond. The inside of the brewery is run like a Swiss watch: very clean, organised, and not an ounce of space (or beer) wasted. If your a big fan of Mac and Jacks like I am, you will appreciate the variety of special brews you can try and/or purchase that are not available at pubs/bars/etc. Finish your tour of the brewery off by purchasing some gear, beer, and other goodies they sell at the store inside!

One of the best beers ever made. You can go in every Sunday for a free brewery tour and taste the phenomenal beers. I love stopping by from time to time and fill up a large growler for super cheap. Last time i went in, it was only $7.

I've been drinking beer for many, many years. I stopped drinking it for awhile because I could never find one that was all that great. Then I had a Mac & Jack's Amber. I fell in love with beer again - but only this beer. If I can't drink Mac & Jack's I don't drink beer. Simple as that!
Free beer tour and samples including a glass. You end up getting about a glass of beer total.

formatted_address: 17825 Northeast 65th Street, Redmond, WA, United States

name: JT Schmid's Restaurant & Brewery

reviews.text: I specifically asked to be seated at a table near television where the game I wanted to watch was playing and promptly was. 20 minutes later another patron asked to change the chanel to a game that was already on several other screens. They changed the chanel and when I spoke up I was told someone else wanted to watch this game instead, and I was out of luck. I had to leave and watch the game somewhere else. That was pretty lousy service. Oh yeah, the pizza crust was undercooked.
Massive burgers, pretty good beer.
Slow service, parking sucks
The Chilean Seabass is unbelievable. Well diversified menu of great food. Good beer. Friendly service. Nice location.

Horrible service. I ordered the drink and never got refilled. No waiter has even come over that I can call. I ended up had to chew the ice to swallow the food. Sent an complaint to the office and nobody even bother to reply. Horrible company. I would never go back.

formatted_address: 2415 Park Avenue, Tustin, CA, United States

name: Lamppost Pizza

reviews.text: I have been eating here since high school! I used to always get their taco pizza with ground beef, cheese, shredded lettuce and tomatoes!! If you are coming here with some friends, I suggest you get the combo appetizer platter that has wings, potato wedges, mozzarella sticks and fried zucchini. For those of you on a diet, there are tons of salad options. There is also a small selection of pastas and sandwiches. I really love their california chicken pizza - it comes with avocado, bsil, and garlic. There is a huge tv so your BF doesnt get bored, some video games for the kids and a little train that runs around the perimeter of the place.
I really like to eat here. They have a lot to choose from! My fav is the California Chicken Pizza. Not the cheapest but you get what you pay for. Workers/Service is good.

I like this Lamppost Pizza, even if it's a little bit farther than the one near my house, but it's worth the drive because the other place had a rude owner. I guess they lost me and gained me in this one. The pizza is good. It's probably because of the cheese. Even their salad is pretty okay. I think though, that their specialty is more of pizzas. Also, there's an added bonus for beer ( in my case ROOT BEER) fans because there is a kind of small pub like sports bar there next to it (inside the Lamppost Pizza) so I guess this would be where school games can be held. Edit: their after parties I mean. Like if they won a home game or something.

It's kind of like religion and politics. Pizza is sacred and this outfit's pie is only just so-so. With so many pizza joints in town, I pretty much don't go here unless one of my kids teams or classes is having an "event" here.
Quality ingredients, ever tried a taco pizza? Well let me tell ya where you can get one!

formatted_address: 14450 Culver Dr, Irvine, California, United States

name: Back Street Brewery

reviews.text: Excellent beer, great atmosphere and service.

formatted_address: 14450 Culver Drive, Irvine, CA, United States

name: Backstreet Brewery
formatted_address: 3002 Dow Avenue #414, Tustin, CA, United States

name: Auld Dubliner

reviews.text: Was given my drink immediately, then waited over 10 min and no one was coming to my table to take my order. About 7-8 customets in the whole place, all of which were served. I walked out. Shame too because im here on business and tip well. Had it been a beautiful day on a friday id understand, but its a dreary thursday evening.

I will NEVER go to the Auld Dubliner in Tustin again. Tonight, after ordering a final round of drinks several minutes before last call, our group of 5 teachers was told (not asked) to "Chug" our drinks and leave. The manager, "Dan," refused to speak with us regarding the manner in which we were being dealt with and instead announced we had to finish our drinks immediately and leave - through a MEGAPHONE. One of the waiters, "Russell," physically pulled the glass beer out of my wife's hand as she was holding it. We were talked down to as if we were a bunch of drunkards that weren't capable of handling our alcohol and treated with more disrespect that I have EVER had in my life. I am still appalled at the way their management handled the entire situation, they wouldn't even give us the time of day to explain why we were being told to chug our drinks and get out. For those of you who work in bars, by 2:00am all alcohol must be gone from the premises... this was at 1:30am, we should have still had 30 minutes to finished our drinks. Honestly, does my writing come off sounding as though I am inebriated? According to "Russell" and "Dan" it should; this happened less than an hour ago. I would ask that you please think twice about patronizing this establishment due to disrespectful manner in which they treat their customers.

Our waitress Catherine didnt know ANYTHING about anything. Charged us for ice, crappy band, nasty bathrooms and the water is to so freaking hot you can barely wash your hand; stupid strobe lighting with all the lights which have me a headache. All around a terrible experience. Will never go to this piece of crap resturant again. Which actually makes me sad since I love the other two locations on Katella ams in Long Beach. Nothing Irish about this place either. You don't know what youre getting yourself into when you wall thru their doors

This place was average.. the service was pretty good but the cost of the drinks weren't reasonable.. the waitress didnt even offer us the happy hour menu when we came in during happy hour. It may have been an off day maybe...but it was simply OK!!!

Avoid this place, don't waste your time or money, one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. Terrible food - had to send back the bad fish and had to ask them not to charge us for it. Drinks - short poor on wine, even the lemonade was watered down. Dirty, disgusting bathrooms. The service was the worst, even before the bad food came out and we had to complain about it, I guess that should have been the first sign to leave.

formatted_address: 2497 Park Avenue, Tustin, CA, United States

name: Bare Bones Grill and Brewery

reviews.text: The appetizers I had came from frozen. Fun bar when there is live music, but I wouldn't ever eat here again.
Amazing happy hour!!! Its my new favorite place to take friends...especially on Thursday nights for ladies night. You pay three bucks for a margarita and get free food!

Food is always consistently good, my favorite ribs and fries of all time! They don't overwhelm the ribs with bbq sauce like some other locations, flavor of the pork shines nicely. A bit of a drive for us now but worth it!

Loved the atmosphere and cannot wait to go back. I ate the entire rack of ribs and it sure was delish! Our waitress was so patient with my fussy two kids. We're planning on going back next week with another couple and their kids.
Tough, gamey ribs. Go to The Corner Stable in Kings Contrivance instead!

formatted_address: 9150 Baltimore National Pike, Ellicott City, MD, United States

name: Ellicott Mills Brewing Co

reviews.text: The staff is awesome! Some of the food is really good but some of it is just blah. The vegetarian chili is good. Once you find the things that you do like, stick with them. This place is more about the bar/people/location and less about the food for me. Has 3 floors - the bar in the basement is so much better now that it's smoke-free. Fun neighborhood pub.
If you go for lunches they have sandwiches between 8.00 to 15.00. Entree plates were average 15 to 20.00.

I loved this place...I went there for the first time not too long ago and tried 2 of the beers. I ended up liking one of the darker beers more than my beer that I purchased, and I don't normally like dark brews. It was sweet, which I enjoy. We ordered the crab dip and love it-- sooo good. I can't wait to go back and try more of the foods!
Menu is a bit small, good chilli, the basement is awesome
never been, mostly due to awful website.

formatted_address: 8308 Main Street, Ellicott City, MD, United States

name: Carolina Brewery

reviews.text: I have been to Carolina Brewery a few times and I am not overly impressed. One issue is parking. The only place to park is behind Franklin near Rosemary or across the street which is a pay lot. I have not been able to find close free parking for this location. The food is not amazing and definitely not worth fighting the parking battle in my opinion. I am not a beer drinker so that means the Carolina Brewery has even less appeal to me.

Monday Night Pub Run – Carolina Brewery on Franklin – 6:30 PM Join us at the Carolina Brewery every Monday night for a 3 or 5 mile run through UNC campus followed by beer, food, and socializing at Carolina Brewery!

Health Inspection Reports This was from March 30th: "Clean ice machine chute of mold mildew at upstairs wait station." Disgusting. Violations from previous inspections include: "Spillage/grime buildup on exterior surfaces of equipment in kitchen. Detail clean exterior of equipment adjacent to onion batter area. Non food contact surfaces should be kept clean." "Ice scoop storage container found with pink slime mold in water at bottom of container. Recommend cleaning during ice machine cleaning cycle. Food contact surfaces shall be kept clean to prevent food contamination. Corrected during inspection."

3 if us went here for lunch around noon on a Sunday with our dog. We were able to eat outside, and had no issues with our husky puppy being there! Staff was super friendly; Beer was great, as well as the food, service, and atmosphere! We would definitely go back! Oh, and free street parking on Sunday- free lot parking all the time!
Great place to get some carolina favorites with some craft beers.

formatted_address: 460 West Franklin Street, Chapel Hill, NC, United States

name: Top of the Hill Restaurant & Brewery

reviews.text: Fun place to eat, great place to chill and drink. The blue ridge blueberry wheat is excellent. Saturday nights are a must! Best views in chapel hill

I absolutely love the location and atmosphere of Top of the Hill but the food has never amazed me. If you are looking to get a view of Chapel Hill, Franklin Street and UNC this is the place to be. If you are looking for the best lunch meal in Chapel Hill you might want to consider other options. I have no eaten dinner there a few times and the dinner menu is significantly better. That being said, this is also one of the best night time atmospheres in Chapel Hill. On a busy Thursday or Saturday night the line is often backed up to Franklin Street, meaning there are about 100 people waiting to get in. There are other options with shorter lines but Topo is often the place to be in Chapel Hill.

The Blueberry Wheat at TOPO is like Chapel Hill's personal Pumpkin Spice Latte - it's only offered in the summer, so students are constantly disappointed to hear it's unavailable in the winter months. But it would hardly be defined as settling for an Old Well White, my favorite craft lager-esque beer in Chapel Hill, NC. Everyone knows they have an incredible view of Chapel Hill and great craft beer, but here's one thing you might not know about: The Klondike - the closest thing you'll get to an alcoholic glass of chocolate milk with a hint of mint. It's not on the menu, but the bartender will know what to do.
Its only value is its location. Better beer and food can be found for similar price within walking distance.
A great place to go get drinks with friends, especially when the weather is nice (outdoor terrace). Lots of good beers on tap. Food is just okay, but portions are plentiful.

formatted_address: 100 East Franklin Street #3, Chapel Hill, NC, United States

name: Linda's Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Linda's Bar & Grill is the prototypical college town bar. It has well-worn booths and cold beer on tap. It offers great bar foods - fries, burgers, etc. - with good service to boot. It's directly across the street from UNC's campus making it a great place to unwind after defending your honor's thesis or crushing that final exam.
Place has a new owner and was super nice and courteous. I had a great time there and will be back. Try their new sweet potato tots :)

Best cheese fries in Chapel Hill! The atmosphere and menu here is fairly spartan, but this is a great place to unwind with a cold beer and the essential cheese fries (with bacon and ranch dressing, of course) just off the end of Franklin Street. There are also a few TVs with sports.
Friendly wait staff tastey burgers and a good atmosphere of a small town pub, complete with old style wooden tables/booths.

formatted_address: 203 East Franklin Street, Chapel Hill, NC, United States

name: Ram Restaurant & Brewery

reviews.text: YUCK! There were only 5 tables seated and it took forever to get our food. I ordered the cheapest salad i could find, and for 10.50 I got lettuce with the most disgusting piece of chicken i have ever tasted. It was not loaded with veggies as the picture showed. I could not cut the kids chicken with a knife. It was full of grissol and very dry. The tea was dark, cloudy and tasted terrible. Their prices are way too high for the quality of food they serve. The bill was wrong when it came. We had to wait around while they found somebody to correct it.
Fair $, wife's salad-?ok, my sandwich was good, clean the men's room!

NEVER get to go food! We have gotten take out twice and both times it was terrible! The first time they got the order wrong and the chicken was raw. This time they had the order wrong & it wasn't ready when I requested. The food was not good - for the cost the salads should have been double in size. They don't give you enough salad dressing even for the meager portion size. Go for the atmosphere not the food!

Good all-american food. Great drinks, great atmosphere and all with a great downtown feel. The staff is friendly, the prices are right and its a great place to go with friends or with family. Ive been several times and always had a great meal except for one time my steak was super dry. But the calamari appetizers are a must!
Different beers are great food good but greasy.

formatted_address: 12750 Parkside Drive, Fishers, IN, United States

name: BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse

reviews.text: This is some of the best food I've ever had! I absolutely love their food. I've normally always had good service, but it's not 100% across the floor. Very good overall though.
A bit pricey. A large selection which I think results in inconsistency. I've always liked what I've ordered though. Love the gourmet mac & cheese!

The cream soda unfortunately is the only redeeming quality, and it's usually in short supply. Continually mess up orders, food takes forever, and the customer service is that of a fast food chain. The food does taste good, if you get what you ordered...
Its always nice to go to BJ's. The service was equal to what I receive in Vegas. Best Caesar Salad ever.
Would slam a 5, if the prices were a bit on the more affordable side.

formatted_address: 190 East Stacy Road, Allen, TX, United States

name: Ganter Brewery USA
vicinity: 406 West South Jordan Parkway, South Jordan
formatted_address: 406 West South Jordan Parkway, South Jordan, UT, United States

name: Beehive Brews
formatted_address: 220 West 10600 South, Sandy, UT, United States

name: C.B. & Potts

reviews.text: Love their fish and chips! My wife loves their hamburgers, and we come about once a month. Very nosy and crowded, as there is nothing to absorb the sound, but that doesn't stop me from going. Kids eat free on Thursday, so if you want a grown up dinner, don't go on Thursdays.
This was a very good experience. The service was great. So was the food and the large booths.
Totally good! Love the nmac and cheese!
Great food; great service

Decent beer and atmosphere, but the food is sub-par. Occasionally the service is also sub-par. If you are more interested in drinks though, feel free to swing by for some of their microbrews. If you find one you love this could be a place for you.

formatted_address: 43 West Centennial Boulevard, Highlands Ranch, CO, United States

name: Lansdowne Arms

reviews.text: Excellent fish and chips! Great outside patio, very cool to sit on the roof or side patio during the summer and they have motorcycle parking on the sidewalk. Great weekend entertainment.

Blackened fish tacos are very good. If you order take out and go pick it up, the WILL be expecting a tip for just handing you your food. If you don't tip, watch out for the stink eye. And if your change is under $1.00 don't even wait for it, you will never see the hostess return with it.
Great atmosphere. Fair food.
Don't waste your time - service and food terrible!
great neighborhood spot with a nice outdoor patio

formatted_address: 9352 Dorchester Street, Highlands Ranch, CO, United States

name: Granite City Food & Brewery

reviews.text: I got there, waited about 10 minutes for a table of 6. Then we sat and our server came. His name was Logan, he was honestly one of the best servers I have had in my life. On top of everything, would have my glass filled before I drank ot to half. The soup of the day was clam chowder, so I had to try it, and it it was THE best clam chowder I have ever had, and eating it with the bread you get, just amazing. After a short wait, our food came and I got a burger and fries, the burger was fabulous, and the fries were good, and they were different they were very small. But still very good. Overall a GREAT place to eat.
Service is hit or miss with any GC location. Beer is good, food is fine but over priced.
Pretzel things are great
Best brewed beer in the cities with really yummy food. The wait is too long
Good food

formatted_address: 11909 Main Street, Maple Grove, MN, United States

name: Growler's Brew Pub

reviews.text: Bought an Amazon Local coupon based on their menu. Went to dinner - oops, no longer had that menu. Ordered a $16 pasta dish - Pappardelle Pasta - thought there would be leftovers. Got a dish of what looked like sauce - where's the pasta, I asked. Waiter described the pasta as fine/thin pasta - I presumed what looked like strings of cheese may have been the pasta. Basically it was a bowl of sauce. There was no substance to the pasta if in fact there was any in the dish. The pasta Pappardelle is in reality a very wide dense noodle. So either they don't know what it is or didn't put pasta in ! My husband ordered the short ribs which he says were delicious - but $17 for 2 short ribs and a small portion of polenta? I know there is an issue in our country of portion control, but if you are going to serve a smaller portion, the price should reduce also ! So basically the beer was cold which was good, but not enough of a draw to go back. Will try Dog Fish as others have suggested. Good Bye Growlers.

The building is really nice and has a nice vibe. The food was also pretty decent. However, Growlers is overpriced. I was really not impressed with their beers, and they were unreasonably expensive. Definitely better off going to Dogfish Head, they have great beers and food at a very decent price!

We were told by more than a few people to make sure we checked out Growlers. The beer selection covered a great range. Make sure to get the beer sampler if you're unsure about what to drink. The appetizer was fantastic (we ordered the Hummus platter), however the main course was lacking. We were a bit surprised by how good the appetizer, service and beer was that the main course would fall so short of expectation. Bottom line, great beer, great samplers, great service, but not great for dinner.

Why is there so much talk of Dogfish on the Growlers board? Growlers brews beer on site and makes their food from scratch (more then others can say). If you want corporate, Gaithersburg has many options. If you want real deal craft brew and scratch food, come by Olde Towne and visit Growlers!!!

Colleagues from the company I work at use Growlers as a regular after work watering hole. In that role I think Growlers hits the spot. Very pleasant environment, reasonably priced beer and some decent if not remarkable grub to end the day with. The beers from the microbrewery are a little hit-or-miss. Their Kölsch is one of the better and more popular ones.

formatted_address: 227 East Diamond Avenue, Gaithersburg, MD, United States

name: Dogfish Head Alehouse

reviews.text: The beer is crazy expensive, the better brews are all north of $10 and many of them come in only 12 oz servings to rub some salt in the wound. Food is decent, I've never had anything that was bad but never anything noteworthy either. Bar and restaurant service is solid, patio service tends to be slow. Other brewhouses often have special, interesting and hard to find beers on tap, this place...does not. Its the same stuff and it gets boring. I work a two minute walk from here and enjoyed coming here on nearly a weekly basis for a few months, but hardly come at all anymore. The beer and menu never really change, the crowd and the bartenders tend to be older and pretty boring and it just isn't worth the cost. Go down the road to Growlers, you'll pay half as much money for better food and more interesting beer.

Pleasantly surprised by this Bar that serves food. They are known for the beers but the food is not bad at all. What really killed me was how well the service ran. We had been seated for just under 5 minutes when the server from the next section came to check on us. Our server took over from there and was excellent. Never had to look around for her... or wonder where things were. Everything from the kitchen to the bar was speedy and correct. I have not been there in years... but thinking I should correct that. The garlic in the Caesar is a little over powering... but everything else at our 8 top was spot on.

Food is priced great for what you get...hummus platter to start...spicy hummus with warm pita bread...it was hard to move on to the meal and i forgot to take a picture of my meal..tasted a friend's marinated culotte steak...cooked rare (i don't usually eat rare)...it was soft, peppery and amazing!...i had the blackened salmon which fell apart and was very good too with a side of fries...i took my time finishing this meal savoring every moment...paired it with the 90 minute ale which was just ok...i will come back for that steak if i am ever in town...
This is one of the Dogfishhead Ale houses. Its got high quality food, an amazing selection of its namesakes craft brewed beers, and a relaxed atmosphere.

First of all I want to say that I am a fan of the beer. On that note I was very disappointed in the whole experience. I was in a party of four (my girlfriend, our friend and her boyfriend), my girlfriend ordered Midas Touch twice and both times was given the wrong beer. Our friend's boyfriend ordered from the beer menu only to be told that the price had been changed on his beer by more than $5 higher. Once our beers finally came, we ordered our food, but waiter only took down one of our orders and the three left over had to order again. Food was alright, and only alright not worth the price. We thought the atmosphere would be more like an ale house, but was was more like a family oriented restaurant on par with T.G.I.F. If you are expecting a brewhouse like Founders, Bells, Three Floyds, etc... I say stay away from this place. You will be bombarded with children and prices that will make you say where is this coming from?

formatted_address: 800 West Diamond Avenue, Gaithersburg, MD, United States

name: BJ's Restaurants

reviews.text: Nice place for beer. They have a pretty good selection. I particularly like he Piraat (bottled). Service was quite slow though, and when they finally brought our beer, they dropped the glasses and a bottle.

The food here was delicious, the wait was pretty reasonable for a Tuesday night, but the service had room for improvement. I was never really sure who our waitress was and I don't think she really knew which table we were... needless to say it was slow to do anything that she was involved in like, approximately, everything.
They have gluten free pizza and beer. Although they ran out of the of gf beer
Beers are good and service is great as well. But food isn't. Too greasy too fatty. Best item in the many is salad with bell pepper and blackened salmon.
It took hour to server our party of 6 for lunch on a day that wasn't even busy. The food and beer was fine. The only complaint was the slow service.

formatted_address: 10690 North De Anza Boulevard, Cupertino, CA, United States

name: Lost Rhino Brewing Co

reviews.text: Good beer, live music and layed back atmosphere is hard to resist. Growler refills are $10, and the food is better than you might expect.
The beer is great. The food is OK- mostly appetizers.
great Beers, good food and friendly staff!
Best root beer on tap!
Good beer, but the brewpub aspect needs a lot of work.

formatted_address: 21730 Red Rum Drive #142, Ashburn, VA, United States

name: THE V
formatted_address: 44630 Waxpool Road, Ashburn, Virginia, United States

name: Samuel Adams Brewery

reviews.text: Fun place to take your out of town guests for an inexpensive and very Boston-y experience. It's a quick, fun tour and a tasting of beer, usually including at least one interesting beer. They also provide a trolley service to a local bar where you can get a Sam Adams patented perfect beer drinking glass for ordering (surprise) a Sam Adams.

I try to go on a brewery tour each time I visit a new city so I'm happy to say the best one is in my own! The Sam Adams Brewery Tour is free (suggested $1 donation) and there's a plentiful sampling of 3-4 beers at the end and you get to keep the tasting glass (perfect for juice in the morning!) The actual tour itself is fun and interactive without dragging on too much. I also like how you physically tour the brewery instead of peeking through windows like I've done at other breweries. If you visit Doyle's Cafe after (down the street and there's a trolley car to bring you!) and buy a Sam Adams beer there, they let you keep the pint glass.

Honestly, the best tour in boston. The im from nyc and this tour alone was worth the trip. Hopefully you get alan as a tour guide! Cheers !! Oh and go to doyles afterwards for an authentic Boston bar.

Although the tour is free, includes a free tasting, and the fact that you get to keep your tasting glasses; this tour is useless. The staff are cheerful and friendly, but there isn't much more after that. They don't seem to have any genuinely educated answers to your questions. In other words, you learn very few details about brewing. It's worth a detour or a visit if you're in the area. There are far superior breweries in Boston, and this one's beer isn't impressive at all.

Sam Adams is a must-do if you ever come to Boston. The tour is fun and informative, and you get free beer at the end! Be sure to stay near the back of the group so you get into the tasting room first during the tour. Sit at the ends of the tables... that way, you get the rest of the pitcher of beer that they pass out. Happy drinking!

formatted_address: 30 Germania Street, Boston, MA, United States

name: Boston Beer Works

reviews.text: Ah, Boston Beer Works. It's the too-clean chain pub with the sparkling laminated menus and too-cheerful waiters trying to pretend it's the cool local hangout pub. They do have pool tables, a selection of interesting beers, and decent nachos, but with so many alternatives close by, I'd have a hard time justifying a visit. It is good though :)
I like this place but the food is just so inconsistent I can't rate it very high. Great beer and cool hang though

The only reason I won't give this place is a 5 is because they don't have full bar. Other than that it is a great place to watch sports as they have many nice TVs, they have pool tables, it is very clean, the beer they brew themselves is quite nice and the food is excellent and varies a good amount for pub food. Def worth going to if you drink beer.

Beer Works is great, but not right before or after a game. Wait until it's started, then head in with a group of friends and order some apps (most of which are AMAZING!). In the summer months, try any of the great beers they have on tap, but make sure to have at least a couple of their Blueberry Ale - PHENOMENAL!

Nearly 15 house-made brews on tap from which to choose to celebrate a Red-Sox victory. The Faneuil Hall location, situated in a former army barracks, has 2 floors and over 16000 square feet, brewing over 3500 barrels of beer a year (equivalent to 868000 pints). Be sure to check out the monthly specials. Highlights: Blueberry & Watermelon Beer, Fried Pickles, Mako-Shark Skewers, Sweet-Potato Fries.

formatted_address: 61 Brookline Avenue, Boston, MA, United States

name: Bukowski Tavern

reviews.text: Good overall dive(ish) bar--good food, service, and one of the widest craft beer selections in the Back Bay. Get a deeply-discounted burger from 5-8pm (also at it's sibling location in Cambridge, a former garage). Instead of spinning the wheel (you'll get laughed at), take my suggestion and buy the Delerium Tremens (Belgian -- named after the shakes of alcohol withdrawal, w/pink-elephants and 9% booze by volume -- the Nocturnum variant is good as well). Warning: Cash and 21+ Only! Highlights: Dead Author's Club, Sweet Potato Fries.
Great selection of beers and great selection of friendly people...
They have a great beer list with over 140 beers. If you are a beer nut you have to go to Bukowski Tavern! Secret tip: On weekday before 8pm a regular burger with fries is 3.19 and a hotdog is 1.19!
Great atmosphere and endless beers
Nice local dive bar. The Hangover burger will cure your ailments from the night before.

formatted_address: 50 Dalton Street, Boston, MA, United States

name: Brighton Beer Garden

reviews.text: Beer isn't cheap, bar staff is mostly women who couldn't tell you if the sport that is on tv has innings, quarters or periods. Bar tender let my glass sit empty multiple times while she flirted with other "customers." The burgers used to be really good, something about the buns is just off lately... they are like stale and crumbly and not in a good way.

It is what it is, a very nice local place. The baretenders are very good looking, although probably not the most efficant around. Want to give me to give you the story? I had a bill. I was happy to leave a decent tip, but I didn't have the change. So I left a few buckyh bartender took the money, took the bill, returned the change, but didn't return th original bill. Which, if youv'e been to a bar or two, you will know is a way to rip people off, respectable bars will return your change and the bill. So, I guess my conclusion is, don't go her if you want an accuratte bill, and want to leave a respectable tip, cause they will rouke ya!
I give this place an elevated Decor rating because of the trivia night. They're great, and have the facilities to handle it. In truth, its a typical sports bar with a lot of seating. No big whoop.

Large selection of beers, plenty of room so you never feel uncomfortable when the bar is packed, the waitresses and bartenders are extremely pleasant and the food is excellent. This place is great for watching a game--lots of TVs
Pretty good sports bar. Food is OK, but you'll likely be coming for the game and beer so its not a big deal.

formatted_address: 386 Market Street, Brighton, MA, United States

name: Boston Beer Co

reviews.text: This isn't actually a restaurant (it operates more as a retail location with free samples) but who is going to complain about good free beer?

formatted_address: 30 Germania Street #1, Jamaica Plain, MA, United States

name: The Harp Pub

reviews.text: The food had no flavor and the flat bread was under cooked and doughy. We tried several items and none of it was worth returning for including fish and chips. We were very disappointed based on reviews. Service was good.
Great fish. Nice atmosphere
The fish and chips are stellar. And the scotch eggs are too. They have a good beer selection and some good happy hour specials as well. The service has always been excellent.
We went in for lunch today for the first time for fish and chips, it's the best we have had. But the service was really not great. Even after this I would go back..
Great food. They have a great selection of food. I take my kids evey Tuesday and they love fish and ships. Great quick service during lunch and dinner. Best fish and ships and chicken curry. Tamer

formatted_address: 1744 South Val Vista Drive, Mesa, AZ, United States

name: BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse

reviews.text: Good place to hang out
Pazooke, no other words needed.
Great food and Great Service. What I like the most is how clean the place is.
If you are looking to have a great time with beautiful place. This is it. Food is so good always fresh and hot
Cannot beat this place for great food! <br/> We take the whole family, its our absolute favorite!

formatted_address: 4585 Chino Hills Parkway, Chino Hills, CA, United States

name: Dillon's Irish Pub

reviews.text: Food was alright. Service was as bad as it gets. 15 minutes to get some water. 30 min to get food that was barely warm. Finished drinks before meal came and waitress walked by 3 times without asking or giving refill. I'll give it one more shot. Then rate based on the average.
Typical local bar. Reasonable prices.
Love this place. My new favorite bar to hangout.

Ordered Long Island Ice Tea and there were very week. Then ordered Captain Morgan and Coke and that was week and watered down. Then ordered Dirty Martini and this was the worst. Drink was short barely half the glass once I took the olives out. After I tasted it it was all olive juice. Worst place; atmosphere is bland and drinks expensive and watered down. Not worth it.
Waited 10 minutes and nobody even took our order so we left. Garbage service.

formatted_address: 13920 City Center Drive, Chino Hills, CA, United States

name: Lexington Grill & Pub

reviews.text: Cozy Atmosphere on a quiet night...and a great environment for all sports fans, especially on Football Sunday. Reasonable prices for food & drinks...and always great fun bartenders and waitresses. Give it a shot!
Very nice atmosphere and friendly people.

formatted_address: 120 New York 304, Nanuet, NY, United States

name: John Harvard's Brew House

reviews.text: Cannot go wrong with any of their brews. Great burger and grilled meatloaf. Comfort food and tasty beer.
Great variety of Ales that they brew with great food and friendly service
Food is good. Beers are good. Servers have always been a little slower than I would prefer.
Good food and beer at a great value. Try the beer they make here, certainly worth it.
Great pub fare and drinks. Try the beer samplers, they're a great way to figure out which of these brews you'll like best!

formatted_address: 1 Worcester Road, Framingham, MA, United States

name: Jack's Abby Brewing

reviews.text: I'm so glad to have a brewery in Framingham now. Jack's Abby is fantastic. They even use locally grown (New England) ingredients in some of their brews. What makes Jack's Abby unique is they brew lagers versus ales (takes more work actually). Get yourself down to Jack's Abby to buy a growler (or two) and visit the gift shop. They will let you taste the various kinds so you can decide which one you love enough to take home. They actually sell it in bottles at Julio's in Westboro, MA.

Just bought a keg of Hoponious Union for the backyard kegerator. What a great beer; hoppy, full of big flavor, and not too bitter like many IPAs. Never heard of Jack's Abbey before I picket it up at Marty's Liquors. Looking forward to brewery tour, and fresh growlers.
Great flavors the IPA is great
Friendly staff, small and elegant operation, growlers only, loved it.
Great new brewery in Framingham. Went and picked up a couple of growlers today. Cannot get enough of the Hoponius Union. Keep up the good work guys!

formatted_address: 81 Morton Street, Framingham, MA, United States

name: Hotshots Sports Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Overpriced, dirty, unfriendly... Avoid this place like the plague!
Love this place. Great place for events, lunch, or to grab a drink.

formatted_address: 215 Ofallon Plz, O'Fallon, MO, United States

name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery

reviews.text: I recently reintroduced myself to the Rock Bottom Brewery in Bellevue and it brought back a rush of memories from many a post-work Happy Hour from when I worked in San Diego. I cannot, and probably shouldn't, say how many beers I have consumed over the years at Rock Bottom or all of the great stories and conversations that I've had in between bites of great brewery grub. The last few times I have been to the location in Bellevue have been wonderfully consistent and although you can never really ever go home again and relive the past, these past few times have been pretty darn close.

Beer and food is exactly what you would expect from a chain brewery. Nothing too fabulous but everything is good at the very least. Their happy hour is awesome ($3.25/beer) and the service is great. No real complains!
Great beer, the seasonal is always good. The food is very good and the service is quick. Try the pulled pork, it is excellent!

It's your typical restaurant/brewery. The food is fine but nothing spectacular, atmosphere is good (have a lot of TV's), the service was ok, although the waitress seemed annoyed with any request we had.
I had the 2 AM Burger. It was amazing! There was bacon, egg, and hashbrown in it - a great trio!

formatted_address: 550 106th Avenue Northeast #103, Bellevue, WA, United States

name: Safeway Bellevue Beverage
formatted_address: 1500 124th Avenue N E, Bellevue, WA, United States

name: Bellevue Brewing Company

reviews.text: I hoped and prayed for this place to be Black Raven with kids allowed. It is not. I had one pint of beer delivered but I ordered two. We ended up sharing it as the staff forgets about the other beer and even worse they "forget" to enter my dinner order. We left cash and walk out with our family and go to Rock Bottom which is a step above this place for service! Servers see us leaving and don't bother to ask why.
Phenomenal food. Incredible beer. Excellent service. Go here.
Excellent good and their IPA is great! Service was fast, friendly and knowledgeable.
Good beer, friendly attentive bartender. Warehouse feeling to the interior.

formatted_address: Suite 2, 1820 130th Avenue Northeast, Bellevue, WA, United States

name: Rock Bottom

reviews.text: Added to my growler collection with an 8$ filled growler. The beer was quite good. I got the growler filled with the Red Ale they had on tap.
Wednesday $1.50 craft beers? What's not to love? The food is great too. Though, the real draw is happy hours.
Typical bar food. We went to watch the super bowl and had a nice time. Not too crowded.
We have yet to find a dish of theirs that we don't like. Well worth the food and the beer is great too. We get jugs to take home all the time!
Food is alright, but the micro brewed beer is always worth the visit

formatted_address: 4238 Wilson Boulevard #1256, Arlington, VA, United States

name: GG Brewers

reviews.text: Great beer, even better people!
great beer and food .his beer list changes as the seasons brews come out ..english,scottish belgian styles....prevail
We ducked into this little gem for a friday night meal, and it far exceeded our expectations! The food was outstanding (try the Roast Beef sandwich!) and the beer was superb. Highly recommended!
Great brews, wines, food, and company. Check for live music and seasonal brews.
Simply outstanding, european style small brew pub. Good conversation, good people, most importantly "perfect beer", temperature was dead on!

formatted_address: 282 North Keswick Avenue, Glenside, PA, United States

name: Glenside Pub

reviews.text: Good food, but a little expensive. Always enjoy the visit.
Glenside Pub has good food -- try the soups. Good selection of beers - including Guiness draft. A neighborhood place with friendly servers. There aren't too many pubs that are cleaner than Glenside.

The beer is great, half and halfs poured very well. That's why my friends and I frequently visited the Glenside Pub over the past year. However, the quality has gradually deteriorated. Since the past year, their food has become simplified, less care has gone into presentation and quality of the products gone into preparation. Service has also gone down. Just this night, our first server left without giving us a heads up, we sat with empty glasses for at least 15 minutes waiting for more. One of the bartenders became our new server, and paid little attention to us. We left him a very small tip(5%) due to the fact that our service and food tonight were horrible. That employee CHASED us down on the street, 2 blocks away from the pub. He told us "Do not ever f***king come here again." My one friend handed him a $20 as we did not want to create a scene. He told us we were ridiculous and never to show our faces again. This Pub went from a great atmosphere with good food and the best Half & Half north of Philadelphia to a reprehensible disgrace of an eatery. Buyer Beware.
Jamie is a fantastic baretender!! The menu hasn't changed in 15 years!!

formatted_address: 122 South Easton Road, Glenside, PA, United States

name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery

reviews.text: Great beer. Phil is a great brewer. Most of the waitresses are nice. Melissa is the best of the ones I've had
Great atmosphere, food, and brews! I love this place and visit as often as I can. Highly recommended to anyone visiting Denver!

Agreed service was slow. Here is a timing of events starting at walking through the door. We were seated 0:25 minutes after entering, then at 3:45 minutes we were acknowledged by waitress. At 10:45 minutes we had our orders taken after asking for more time. There are approximately 22 patrons here, 2 servers and 1 barkeep (for timing reference). Food arrived at 45:05 minutes and was cold, but tasted good. Finished eating at 52:45 and got our check at 63:13. Atmosphere was great. Got to see all the vessels working and making beer. Music was mostly country, CCR and changed to what sounded like someone dying.
The service was ok. Maybe the reason its there was 3 people. The fries are macdonals fries come on! The steak had no flavor! Not going back !
good food and great customer service

formatted_address: 9627 East County Line Road, Englewood, CO, United States

name: Lone Tree Brewing Company

reviews.text: Weird but great place. In a sort of industrial building. But you don't care about that....they have good beer, a great staff and a great clientele. All the beers are good, particularly anything fueled by nitro. Go. And go back. Tell them you will pay extra for nitro and that they should have one nitro, maybe in rotation, at all times. Also, beg for a cask conditioned ale!
Love the Beer and especially QUIERO AREPAS FOOD TRUCK ON SATURDAY NIGHTS!!!! GR8 beer and quality Venezuelan Sandwiches!!
Great beer. Note that this is a brewery, not a restaurant. You can bring your own food or have it delivered.

These folks know what they're doing. Their excellence and quality execution is evident in all of their beers and they've wisely chosen a severely under served part of the craft market in Metro Denver. I've patronized the LT Tap Room several times found it a friendly place inhabited by locals who appreciate good beer.
Great beer good service my only complaint is that they close pretty early

formatted_address: 8200 Park Meadows Drive #8222, Lone Tree, CO, United States

name: Brewery Bar III

reviews.text: Love their green chili here, and this is the best place for chili rellenos, perfectly crispy. Laid back atmosphere, decor is typical of most other Mexican restaurants around Denver.
Really good Mexican restaurant! Great prices!
Great Mexican food. Informal and casual.
Cant get enough of this place. The special beef burrito is to die for.... Try the half and half chili Verde. Crave it every week!

Not sure what the buzz is about Brewery Bar, but the 3 times I've been, the food was marginal at best & the service matched it. There are SO MANY places in Denver to get decent or better Mexican food, so why waste your money on something so marginal as Brewery Bar?

formatted_address: 9228 Park Meadows Drive, Lone Tree, CO, United States

name: C.B. & Potts

reviews.text: I really like this place for Friday happy hour and dinner. I probably wouldn't pick this restaurant otherwise though. The food is good and the decor is nice, but it is best for having a few beers with friends. I used to go to the one in Fort Collins back in College. I enjoyed that one as well.
Really great comfort food, and amazing staff! Every time I've gone there, I leave with a smile on my face!
Good food. Good atmosphere. Good beer. Avoid the garlic fries. It's literally a tablespoon of mashed garlic dumped on your fries. Not exactly garlic powder seasoning. VERY strong stuff!
Love the pizza and the beer specials!
One of the best places to eat in the Ranch. Good food and great beer. Service is a little slow.

formatted_address: 6575 Greenwood Plaza Boulevard, Englewood, CO, United States

name: Lukas Liquors Superstore

reviews.text: The store manager is a joke!!! This place sucks and I will never be in again... I was part of a bridal party and me and a couple others from the wedding went to this store after pictures to pick up some stuff for me and the guys and one other guy didnt have his id which he came in to use the bathroom not intending to buy any sort of liqour and they wouldnt sell me a pint I was buying for the groom as a gift....... this place sucked and the manager was a big redneck!!!!!
Best deals in town, love the rebates!

Passing through CO on my way home to KS, I wanted to stop and pick up all the beer I couldn't find at home. I emailed in advance and got an excellent reply from Nic confirming what they had in stock. When I got there, James the beer guy helped me find what I wanted...and then some.

Even in comparison with larger stores such as, Total Beverage, or Tipsy's, the prices and selection are always amazing, many other liquor stores occupy this part of town including Heritage Liquor and a number of smaller stores but no one can compare to this location. The only downside is that I personally wish they remained open later.

Every time I come in or call everyone is so friendly and knowledgeable. They are always able to help me find exactly what I am looking for and it's usually a least a couple bucks cheaper than anywhere else!!!

formatted_address: 8457 South Yosemite Street, Lone Tree, CO, United States

name: SanTan Brewing Company

reviews.text: Nice location in downtown Chandler. My first time to San Tan Brewery. Beers were average, I had the IPA and sampled the porter, black IPA, and amber. The guest beer list was brought to our attention late in the evening, but a surprisingly good selection. Very much a "bro" crowd for a Friday night. I wouldn't rush to go back.

Excellent service. Nicole brought us a few samples of beer, once without even asking just based off what else we had ordered. She was the right amount of friendly. The fries were amazing. The food was delicious. The ambiance had a great pub feel. This is definitely on my list to go back to.
Great place for food n fun
This is a great local brewery. And the food is even better than the beer - which is saying a lot. The burgers stuffed with cheese are AMAZING. And go hungry - because they are huge.
Christmas in July! Food was OK, never could be like moms! Service was awesome, beer was even better.

formatted_address: 8 South San Marcos Place, Chandler, AZ, United States

name: Premier Gourmet

reviews.text: Omg..what a nice place...

formatted_address: 3904 Maple Road, Amherst, NY, United States

name: Pizza Plant

reviews.text: The Pizza Plant Pods are awesome. You can definitely split one between two people. Pizza's pretty good but you have to try the pods.

Our favorite pizzeria by far. That could in part be due to the amazing rotating craft beer selection. I will say that the pizza is almost as good as the beer. We love the circular chicken. Never had a pod, but they do look good. It's saying alot that this is one of my family's favorite restaurants, as we live in Canada. The drive is under an hour and totally worth it.

Cool spot. Stopped in for one beer to check it out and I really enjoyed their unique selection on tap. Ended up having a coulpe and a Pizza Pod that was excellent. Very friendly and extremely knowledgeable bar tender. The place does a nice job of not being a chain restaurant but also not being a run down-simple pizza menu place too.
Food was excellent , service was great, good price. Love the atmosphere!
The Popeye Pod was excellent.

formatted_address: 5110 Main Street, Williamsville, NY, United States

name: Beehive Brews
formatted_address: 220 West 10600 South, Sandy, UT, United States

name: Tin Roof Grill

reviews.text: This place has great food and pretty good prices. Their pulled pork sandwich is one of my favorites. I would recommend this place to anyone!
Awesome service and food a little pricy but worth it!
This place a really good food and resonable prices. Have been there several times and never been dissappointed.
Great brunch on weekends.
I had the Sausage Pizza and loved it. The service was great! My waitress was a doll :) If your looking for a cozy little place for great food and sports you will love this place.

formatted_address: 9284 South 700 East, Sandy, UT, United States

name: Hamden Brewery Co
formatted_address: 1950 Dixwell Avenue, Hamden, CT, United States

name: Rock Bottom

reviews.text: Took some foreign guests here to eat Oct. 4, 2012. Can't remember much about the food, my guests seemed to like it and there were no complaints, so I would say it was average. However, even on a Thursday evening the place was nicely filled out, and the atmosphere was very vibrant and lively. The waitstaff was very attendant and friendly. Thanks to the atmosphere the dinner felt very relaxed and "American" for my guests. Also, the beer was rather good, and the fact that it was brewed there was a hit with my guests. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone bringing foreign visitors.

I understand this place doesn't put food on its list of priorities, but its often mediocre or hardly edible. I usually only go to waste time before the movies, but I can't even do that here anymore. I guess the best things I can say about it is that its always clean and the service has almost always been good.
Great food, good beer and I would recomend the place.
Mediocre. Food was ok but a little too expensive for the quality. Beer is good. Nice atmosphere.
Very solid beer, and respectable menu. Atmosphere is fun and relaxed.

formatted_address: 28256 Diehl Road, Warrenville, IL, United States

name: Turtle Mountain Brewing Company

reviews.text: Great soft pretzels. They have a special called a pretzel and a pint. Their calzones are really good too. They have a bar set up with power strips for tablets and laptops.

Everything about turtle is great if you love great micro brewed beer and fire cooked pizza it's the place for you, if your idea of a good beer is a bud light you may want to head somewhere else. Get in there and give it a try at least once, they are super nice and will let you sample a beer if your not sure.
All i can say is fat noise. Nasty beer, nasty food, poor service.
Best beer nachos and pizza in Rio Rancho
The food is only surpassed by the great beers... Its "Cheers" in Rio Rancho.

formatted_address: 905 36th Street Southeast, Rio Rancho, NM, United States

name: Fat Squirrel Pub & Grille

reviews.text: I've been there a few times. In the last year it just went into the toilet. The last time I went, the potatoes were fried in motor oil or something. The food is just bleah. I felt ill the last two times I ate there... not going back and not giving them a chance to kill me. I wonder if this place would be on tv for kitchen nightmares.... *shudder*
Best burger I've ever had!!! It's built your own and real sliced avocado not that stuff from a bag frozen!!! So good!!!!

When me and my family went here, they were hosting some kind of trivia night that was really fun to watch. The food was awesome, and they had a pretty wide array of drinks on special. It was a little pricey, but I feel like I got what I paid for. I got their fish and chips, and it was probably the best I've ever had. They don't have much in the way of dessert, but the potato bread pudding we got was very delicious. Our waitress was polite, and I don't feel like we waited too long for anything to come out, especially considering how busy it was. I'd definitely like to come back here again.
ribs had no flavor, complained but was charged anyway fries used to be cut, now they use frozen fries

I don't know if we went on an off day but we won't be going back. The worst part was the service. Our waiter was pleasant enough but super slow and utterly unattentive. The food was ok but just very bland. Could be authentic to pub food but not for us. Would not recommend.

formatted_address: 3755 Southern Boulevard Southeast, Rio Rancho, NM, United States

name: Walnut Brewery

reviews.text: Pizza is awesome... Order as an app! Burger was not bad either, awesome onion rings. Service was ok... This is a college drinking hole, more attn seems to be on ppl just drinking but we had a great time.

My wife and I build the foundation of our marriage in the Walnut getting into the mug club. It was well worth it, the staff is friendly, and got to know us, and the beer is tasty. For a while they shared a menu with the Rock Bottom, much to the disappointment of the regulars. The neat thing is that after some complaints, they switched back. Good to have a local business that listens to their customers!
Busy on weekends. Friendly atmosphere and good beer.
Cool place & their food is good too. Try the smoked salmon fish & chips, it sounds a little odd I know but it is delicious. The patio is a great place to people watch too.
Old thumper is one of the most complex beers I have had, an amazing experience, suggested to anyone whom love beers.

formatted_address: 1123 Walnut Street, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Mountain Sun Pub & Brewery

reviews.text: The food was excellent and reasonably priced. When a mix-up led to our appetizer being left in the oven too long, the cook came to our table right away to explain and insisted on comping a new one.

I've lived in Boulder for my entire life, and I know food and restaurants around here. This is absolutely the best food, the best beer, the best prices, and some of the best service you can hope to find around town. Don't pay attention to negative reviews unless you are thinking of wait times, which can be quite long (up to an hour), but if you're in the mood for excellent food and beer at great prices, this is absolutely the place to be. I recommend everything. Even the veggie entrees are amazing. Go here and love it!
This place is the bomb! I really enjoyed the time that I spent here last weekend. This place is the epitome of fun and I am planning to go back here.

We stopped in for a beer - this place was recommended for a "true" Boulder experience. The waitress came to the table and asked what kind of beer we liked. I said IPA for me, and Kolsch for my girlfriend. She ran off and brought back 4 samples for each of us. I ended up with a very tasty Rye beer. I have not had a Rye here in the DC area except for what a friend brewed up himself. We had chips and salsa and guacamole. Service was very good, the value was great, and the beer was excellent. This is a simple place where everyone seemed to be enjoying the beer and food. I highly recommend.
Great location! The parking is spacious and with enough light to determine which key is which. The design inside is awesome too. I love the graffiti in the restrooms.

formatted_address: 1535 Pearl Street, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Twisted Pine Brewing Co

reviews.text: Best brewery in Boulder!! Small-town vibe with great food and awesome brews. This is my #1 go-to brewery in Boulder!
Fun, small Brewery. Did not try the food, but good beer and a nice atmosphere. For kicks Try the Ghost Face Killa.
Try the ghost pepper beer, it's definitely worth it!

On a beer trip to Boulder, Twisted Pine was the only place I visited that I hadn't heard of. I am surprised I'd not heard of them, considering how great they are. The employees arranged and impromptu tour for my group and one other in the bar. The beer is unique and excellent.

Beer was great. The IPA, Raspberry Wheat, and the Chile beer stood out. Food was OK. Service was awesome. Friendly staff and the kitchen stayed open extra late just for us. Highly recommended if you're looking for great beer and service and good food.

formatted_address: 3201 Walnut Street, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Boulder Beer

reviews.text: Great beer! Tour with free beer at the end. Okay food but that's not why you come here.
Great beer, great service! Love the live music on the patio in the summer!
Boulder beer has a great selection of even better beers. Must try the hazed n infused if you're a hop forward beer lover. They offer a wide range of enjoyable beers
I highly recommend the Hazed and Infused if you like Pale Ales
Friendly atmosphere, quick food! The beer is totally drinkable.

formatted_address: 2880 Wilderness Place, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Brewers Association

reviews.text: I LOVE Odell's 5 Barrel and 90 Shilling..... so yummy!!
90 Shilling. Drink it, love it, be happy.
90 Shillings is so legit

formatted_address: 736 Pearl Street, Boulder, CO, United States

name: BJ's

reviews.text: My party phoned in a day in advance that the nine of us would be there at 6pm. They don't take reservations, but they will tell you that if you call them and let them know in advance you are coming with a large party (9 in our case) they will be able to seat you much quicker. Well, it took us an one hour and fifteen minutes to get seated, even though we phoned them the day prior and the day of. Once we were seated, with four children between the ages of 1-4, we had no service for 20 minutes. Once a waiter did arrive, she took our drink order and abruptly left before we could order the apps we wanted. We then waited another 20 minutes for our drinks. At this point, we asked the manager for help since the four kids were going nuts. He turned away mid-sentence and was never seen again. The waitress finally showed with the drinks and told us any food we ordered would take an hour. We looked over at the six empty tables behind us, picked up our drinks and walked out of that mismanaged restaurant, resolving never to suffer from their "service" again. Plus their pizza tastes like Pizza Hut pizza, which is never a good thing.

*** BJs has moved to across the street from REI *** This is my favorite restaurant in the country! I've been to BJs all over the country and this one did not disappoint! Liked it so much I went twice in 2 days and tipped my waitress 40%. Great service, great food, great atmosphere!

Food and drinks are above average but nothing spectacular. Service is alright, but I was hassled when trying to use a deal through Google offers. It's great that they offer these deals but at least train your employees on how to use them.
Really good burgers and pizza. The real reason to come is the beer though. Try out the Jeremiah red
The beer they brew isn't amazing, but they have a great list of guest drafts and bottles. The food makes up for the beer and watching football here is great!

formatted_address: 1690 28th Street, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Oscar's Pub

reviews.text: I've been to this bar a total of 10 times. I can say that out of the two bartenders whom I've encountered (Matt and Ian, who also own the bar), Matt is the one who makes everyone feel welcome and always has a smile on his face. Ian brings his personal life to work so much that his patrons feel awkward and sometimes even attacked (depending on his mood). Overall, there is a good atmosphere, plenty of pool tables, a decent jukebox and a great patio. My advice: just stear clear of Ian and you'll have a wonderful experience at this establishment.

formatted_address: 2850 29th Street, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Brewing Market Coffee

reviews.text: The store is set in a small alcove of a historic building in Boulder. Space within is physically limited, though the world of delightful coffee that expands once you cross the threshold is near limitless. The place is a monument to the celebration of the bean.
This store is to small to really spend time in. Get your coffee and move on. Brewing Market has some of the best coffee in Boulder
The Brewing Market makes a nice Latte. There are 3 or 4 tables to sit at with a couple outside. Half a block off of the walking mall makes for a great location.
I've been to Brewing Market twice, and have ordered a cup of dark roast and a cup of light roast coffee. Both cups were expensive and incredibly bitter. I don't plan on trying it a third time.
Too expensive, bitter Espresso and aweful soy milk

formatted_address: 1918 13th Street, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Brewing Market

reviews.text: Great latte. Nice atmosphere.

One thing that sets the Boulder Brewing Market apart, besides its great location and the fabulous European-style candy case, is the outstanding array of tea and coffee accessories, including cast iron Japanese "tetsubin," hand-made Mexican mugs with etched and glazed folk motifs, coffee machines and utensils, stylish Italian espresso cups, and a collection of extraordinary paper-cut greeting cards. This is a place not only to drink, graze, and chat or surf, but to do some serious shopping for kitchen gadgetry and special gifts.

This was my favorite place for years and years and YEARS......and their chai can be great...but I'm finally realizing that I just can't go there anymore. Besides the sometimes ridiculous wait...there are too many inconsistencies. A wet cap is a whole different animal ...depending on who makes it. You just never know what you're going to get. Their Chai same thing....sometimes is syrupy sweet and sometimes it's great. Their green is always sweet...but even their black is too....but depending on the day. The staff turnover is so frequent I"m sure that's part of it...it is sad to see it go....but just don't want mystery coffee anymore. Bye Bye Brewing Market.

formatted_address: 2525 Arapahoe Avenue, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Brewing Market Coffee

reviews.text: Fast service and frienly people. Good chai.

The employees are simple plebs but they know their coffee.the prices are a bit over the top four the quality and quantity of coffee you get but overall your money is better spent here than any other coffee place in boulder. Ozo if you want fancy, 711 if you want quantity or this place if you want a little of both.

They have taken the time and cared enough to create new chai recipes! They now have the second best homemade chai in Boulder besides Naropa. Their original chai sucked. The new ones are vastly improved. Very important for a coffee shop to make their own chai from scratch, to appease the teetotalers. But Bhakti, although a retail product, is still the best available in this town.

This is personally my favorite place to study. The atmosphere is nice and if you like a little quiet background noise while you work, the Bmart is perfect for that. I have tried a huge portion of their drink selection and i've liked most of it. I sometimes have trouble deciding between drinks, so I tend to ask the baristas which they prefer and that always ends well. In response to an earlier comment; yes, the staff like to gossip and talk with each other, but I've never seen them neglet a customer(and i'm there a lot). Also, I like seeing the staff chatting and being sociel it makes them more approachable, which helps when i need coffee advice or just a refill on the water container.

I really enjoyed the first coffee I had there, my most favorited coffee yet! Since I couldn&#39;t wait to go back, and had huge expectations, I wasn&#39;t quite as satisfied the second time around, although I&#39;d still say I had great coffee overall. The atmospheres good, sometimes with quite eccentric people, and the staff could use some enthusiasm sometimes although I am going to go back in the future.

formatted_address: 2610 Baseline Road, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Redstone Meadery

reviews.text: Great honey wine. I really appreciate the bottle credit for recycling their bottles. The bottles use resealable caps. I always enjoy a good meed tasting.
Delicious mead! Come here if you like honey.
Fun, hidden gem of a tour, with lots of variety in the samples.

We stopped by one evening after work and were delighted with what we found in this small, Boulder meadery. We thoroughly enjoyed tasting 11 of Redstone's nectars (carbonated) and honey wines (non-carbonated) and were quickly brought up to speed on the world of mead by the friendly tasting room staff. There was something for everyone, as the complete tasting represented a wide range of sweet to dry varieties and encompassed numerous fruit and spice infusions. Everyone wound up buying a bottle of their favorite to enjoy at home and a few lucky people in my family will have a very merry Christmas, thanks to Redstone. Make sure to kick in a couple of bucks to try the reserve bottles as well as the mead filled chocolate, their more than worth it.

formatted_address: 4700 Pearl Street #2A, Boulder, CO, United States

name: Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurant

reviews.text: This is a great to place to dine. I used to be regular in their Columbus OH restaurant and I loved dinning there every time and I'm glad that they have a presence in Chicago area. The food and atmostphere is really great. You will also have an opportunity to see how they brew their amazing beer. Don't forget to try the beer sampler.
excellent beer, greasy and unwashed dish... For the lunch GO ROMA on the left - much better and not such expensive.
Friendly staff and a great menu, this place has a great atmosphere
Excellent food, excellent beer, good variety, a little pricey for the area.
Gastro-pub style with good beer. The portions are reasonable, but not enough for lunch the next day. Good specials throughout the week.

formatted_address: 639 East Boughton Road #100, Bolingbrook, IL, United States

name: Carolina Ale House

reviews.text: a great place to eat and hang with friends. if your having a birthday they give you a free dessert! definitely a fun place especially during big sports events since they have screens everywhere.
This is a great New Fun Place to Hanout you Can Dine & If The Game Is On You Can Watch & Cheer Along With Other's Great Food , Great Open Atmosphere
Good food and awesome UFC zone.
The food and service was great....but we were outside and the bugs were bad. You'd probably want to eat inside.

I normally go to the Miller's chain of Ale Houses. But I got a gift card for Carolina Ale house, so I went! It was good, the server was nice. Four of us went, we all liked our food. The beer was cold and tasty. I couldn't say much about the atmosphere b/c it was Christmas Eve, so it was pretty dead. I will say this, it wasn't bad at all, in fact it was quite nice.

formatted_address: 2618 Weston Road, Weston, FL, United States

name: SBC Restaurant and Brewery

reviews.text: We stopped here yesterday for a beer. Their home crafted beer had good flavor, went down easy. Steak tips were phenomenal.
Food is ok, beer is ok to good depending on what you expect. The beer won't win any awards but is better than many.

After being seated and not receiving as much as a glance for 15 minutes, the group of 4 of us walked out. The tables around us seemed equally unattended. Was looking forward to trying their beer but never got the chance. Don&#39;t waste your time. This was on a Saturday night.
Nothing special. Great beer selection. Decent food. Have had some bad food experiences.

My dad loves this place....for the beer. He loves beer, and this is a brewing company. I, however dont drink beer, so need to rely on the food...which is ok. Ive been there 3 times, and each time was because someone else wanted to go, not because I wanted too. My friend was our waitress, which was kinda funny...they hire a lot of kids from Fairfield high schools.

formatted_address: 2600 Post Road, Southport, CT, United States

name: Main Street Tavern

reviews.text: Great atmosphere, great food - the salmon is very tasty!!! yum! and the breadpudding is the best! One of my favorite places in BA!

Main Street Tavern incorrectly over charges on tax. If you check your bill you'll see the taxes are around 26 percent. This is not only unethical, it is illegal. We told the server and the manager, but both said they were powerless to help or change it. It leaves you with the pleasant choice of either stiffing your server or over paying for your meal. I have reported this to the Better Business Bureau, but thought people should be made aware.
Super delicious and cool. These people really understand cheese! You must try their mozzarella sticks, they're the size of corn dogs!
Very good! Hard place to find but worth it. Great steak. 16$ i have had worse at 5 star steakhouses!

This is a nice place, a bit pricey and most of the food choices are a bit to frou-frou for my tastes, but I have to say Jessica and Swan are awesome as servers! Not really a pub, it's more of a restaurant that happens to serve beer and mixed drinks.

formatted_address: 200 South Main Street, Broken Arrow, OK, United States

name: Ram Restaurant & Brewery

reviews.text: Great food and beer selection, and I had great service for lunch in the bar.
good food but i would say there a little bit overpriced.
Not a single bad thing to say....excellent service, atmosphere, food is amazing, decent prices. Definitely get what you pay for, in a good way.
We love this place!!!! Awesome food and awesome service! !!!!
I ate there today and it was as good as always. If you want a good burger and fries they are a great place to go.

formatted_address: 3272 East Pine Avenue, Meridian, ID, United States

name: Brewforia Beer Market

reviews.text: A great selection, fun menu, decent location. A bit small so it can get crowded but I have always been able to find a seat.

Horrible customer service. I placed an order with Brewforia on May 18th and my card was charged on the 21st with no tracking number sent to me. On the 23rd I emailed them to find out why my card was charged but I had yet to receive a tracking number and received no response. The next day I received a tracking number and I figured all was well. When I received the box from the looks I was scared there was going to be damage but luckily there was not. The fact nothing was broken was nothing short of a miracle. However, if the shipping practice they used for my box is the norm I guarantee there is to be issues for others. The box had about 3 feet of shipping paper folded in the bottom and then the Cans and Bottles just sitting on top of that and not wrapped. I'm truly amazed everything made it ok. Kudos to UPS I guess. Here's where the real fun starts I order 4 items and only received 3 of those items. There were also 3 extra cans in the box but I assumed these were clearly extras as this is normal for beer ship places to do. So I give them a call to inquire about my missing bottle and immediately the lady states they'll just issue me a refund and doesn't offer to ship me the missing bottle or anything. She says I'll receive an email shortly from them with the details of my refund. No big deal just a little confused why they didn't offer to ship the bottle. I had not received and email and saw no pending payments on my account so I decided to give them a call again. This time the same lady tells me they called me on the 20th(Sunday) and spoke to me and I agreed to exchange the missing bottle for the 3 cans. Really you called me on a Sunday??? I think I would remember this conversation oh and I think I would have a record of this call in my call logs too? She repeatedly says "well I don't know what to tell you the customer agreed to this." She finally agreed to issue refund again however, I'm not holding my breath. It is now over a week since I was told I'd receive a refund and I've seen nothing yet. Based on their packing practice and lack of customer service I would advise to not do business with Brewforia.
Microbrew drinker's paradise. And the food is delicious!

If you like great beer, you have to stop by. They have many taps with average price per pint ~$3.25, plus walls of bottled beer you can open and drink while you're there. The pizzas are made in house and are very good. However; they are unique, so don't expect to see the usual. Did I mention they have LOTS of great beers?!
Excellent selection of beers but overpriced.

formatted_address: 3030 East Overland Road #100, Meridian, ID, United States

name: Rudy's Pub & Grill

reviews.text: Been a few times but always seem to forget it's there...went the other day for lunch and will now make a point to keep it in the front of my mind.
