The food is excellent...the menu has a great variety and everything we had on our table the other day for lunch was fantastic. The mushroom bisque was fantastic and salads and sandwiches were great. Really solid neighborhood pub/grill!

My wife and I came in for date night and had a great time. Order any sandwich and you won't be disappointed. Our server Ashley was outstanding! She had many tables and still gave amazing service! New favorite place!
Great bar for a few after work. Food is solid but service in dining room sucks.
The service was good, but the food was bland.

My go to neighborhood sports bar. Good solid pub food, plenty of TVs, shuffleboard and great staff. Food is a little overpriced but quality and service makes up for it. Enjoy that it is child friendly.

formatted_address: 2310 East Overland Road, Meridian, ID, United States

name: Slanted Rock Brewing Company
formatted_address: 2374 East Cinema Drive, Meridian, Idaho, United States

name: Odell Brewing Co

reviews.text: Odell has a great selection of even better beers. Must try the90 Shilling if you're an amber beer lover. They offer a wide range of enjoyable beers

Love their beer and their brewery. Very relaxed and friendly. They do beer tours and have a beer flight tasting that it a great way to try all of their beers that are in season. Also ask to have a nitro beer. It totally changes the flavor!
I love the happy atmosphere, culture and the best of all the crafted beer. You will always be happy here :) Make sure that you sign up for a toue of the brewery. It is amazing!
Classically excellent beers. Always among my favorites and a great taproom atmosphere to boot.

Best brewery experience yet! The beer is simply fantastic. The expanded complex and tasting room is bustling with staff to get you beer, answer question or whatever... My favorite is the Mercenary DIPA. Another can't miss beer is the Town Pump Ale; only available here and at Town Pump in downtown Fort Collins.

formatted_address: 800 East Lincoln Avenue, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: New Belgium Brewing

reviews.text: great experience. everyone treats you like a member of the new Belgium family. while here I recommended getting a tester of each specialty beer from the love collection. when I went they had ten amazing beers you couldn't find anywhere else. with $15 you get to try them all. **show up around noon so you can get in on a tour group. **

Awesome place. They went above and beyond what I would expect from a brewery. We happened to show up when they were closed, but someone happened to be there and gave us a couple samples and talked to us about their beers. The beers were very tasty and interesting (lips of faith series). Thanks for making our day!
This brewery has some of the best beers in the state of Colorado. They have just about any flavor you want, and their brewery tour is amazing! Tour de Fat is so much fun as well!

My partner and I recently toured the New Belgium Brewery, and we had a fabulous experience. Not only was the beer wonderful, but our tour guide, Scott, was both informational and delightful. What a wonderful brewery. No wonder the beer is the best.
Great tours! Be sure to call ahead... They fill up fast

formatted_address: 500 Linden Street, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: The Fort Collins Brewery

reviews.text: My husband and I tried beer tasting for the first time at this brewery. The bar tender was helpful in explaining the process and the cost of the tasting was around $7.00. And we got to tast each one of their beers. After the tasting we tried out the restaurant and we not disappointed! The waitress was new but whoever was training her was very knowledgable and helpful when my husband ordered the lamb sandwich well done. He told us that the longer you cook the lamb the harder and more dehydrated it becomes so he suggested a medium well cook. He was right! It was perfect, tasty and HUGE! The fries were amazing and we will definitely returne when we move to Colorado!
Great experience. Very good food at reasonable prices. LOVED watching the bottling line. Great beers.
Great beer and food! Very friendly service.
Stopped here during GABF week and loved the location looking at the brewery. Food and service were excellent
Love coming here to try beer. Fun and a great place to hang out. Try the Major Tom's Pomegranate Wheat.

formatted_address: 1020 East Lincoln Avenue, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: Equinox Brewing

reviews.text: We settled on Equinox initially out of necessity – few of the other notable breweries were open on the Sunday we were there. Equinox, though, proved to be an exceptional “alternative” to the more well-known establishments of New Belgium and O'Dells. With ample indoor and outdoor seating (the beer-garden was of a quaint yet excellent size, nestled up against the open brew-room), shuffle-board and numerous board games, Equinox seemed like a great place to settle down for a night of delicious beer and great friends. We ordered the sampler tray, which consisted of six of their brews: IPA, Red, Golden, Porter, Pale, and Brown. The beers were good, but none stood out – in general, they were standard variations of their respective styles and offered less in variation and originality. That said, they were invariably delicious. With t-shirt in hand, we left satisfied and ready for our next adventure.
Great Beer, good atmosphere! Highly recommended, my favorite place to stop for a pint in Fort Collins.

Exceptional Microbrewery with a full portfolio of good beers across a wide range of styles. The beer garden is great, all be it small. Beer snobs can skip a few of the microbreweries in town, but don't miss this when you go to Odells and New Belgium!
Pleasant little brewery in Fort Collins, definitely will be returning for more!
Really neat little place I stumbled upon just off of College Ave. Fantastic beer garden in the back to complement a delicious Pale Ale.

formatted_address: 133 Remington Street, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: Coopersmith's Pub & Brewing

reviews.text: Remaining in Old Town, we travelled the short distance to Coopersmith's Pub and Brewery, which offered a much different feel – a bit darker and with at least five billiard tables, Coopersmith's felt more like a bar than a brewery. Not that that's a bad thing, of course. We sat at the bar and ordered another sample tray: Pale Ale, Stout, Hanjabi, Green Chile Ale, IPA and Brown. Oddly enough – and despite the interested and eclectic choices on show – we left with a similar feel to Equinox: not even the Green Chile, which was relatively mild and lacked any sort of punch, be it alcoholic or chile-hot, or the hanjabi, which went down like a Pale, could 'wow' us. Chile beers are rare, and the good ones can mix the hotness of the chile with the smooth finish you want from a beer – this left us a bit flat in both departments. The Brown and IPA's were pretty much interchangeable between locations. They do offer a menu, which seemed moderate, but we did not partake. Coopersmith's was busy, the location prime, and if we had planned a longer evening, might have drawn us in with the billiards and general bar/college vibe. As it was, we took our samples and then took our leave.

Coopersmith's is an excellent option for a family visiting from out of town. Their food is excellent, and the pool side is fun for a game. However, their beer is not as excellent - they have constant problems with diacetyl (fake butter flavor) because they rush their beers too much. But still worth it just for the tasty food. Vegan options.

the good: the beers and ciders can be very tasty. the bad: some of the bartenders and waitstaff are inexperienced and it shows. Add that to a bad attitude, and lack of courtesy, and I am one of many who will never come back to the bar.

Food was delicious. Fish and chips were great with the best tartar sauce I've had. Husband had black and blue burger which was tasty as well. Kolsch beer was good. Root beer and cream soda not very sweet. Service was kind of slow but they were busy. Recommend this place highly.
Some of the best microbrewed beer I've ever had. You have to try the Albert Dam Bitter!! Food is also great. Bar side is fun too with many pool tables and dart boards.

formatted_address: 5 Old Town Square, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: Pateros Creek Brewing Company

reviews.text: Love this place! The beer is great! The patio is a comfortable place to relax and have a drink, and they regularly have live music. Go check it out!!!!
Cozy, cool patio. Lots of food trucks (waffle lab), including monthly food truck festivals. Newly expanded tap room. Friendly staff (harass steve if he's there). Occasionally excellent beers.

Love the beer here, in the summer time they have a food truck just outside a lot of the time. Every Thursday they have a small batch that typically only lasts a few days. They take one of thier standard beers and infuse it with whatever they choose. They are still fairly new, but thier beers tastes like they have been brewing for years. Highly recomend them, check them out.
small but nice and friendly, good beer too
I love this place! It's a hidden-away intimate little gem in the heart of Fort Collins. The folks that run it are super-nice, and the beers that I have tried are all fantastic. Check it out.

formatted_address: 242 North College Avenue, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: C.B. & Potts

reviews.text: I ate a "Thanksgiving dinner plate" here this year on Thanksgiving 2012. I came here and the service was poor, I had to get my own beer that was sitting at the bar wait station, and had to ask the hostess for my food as well. For $20, the Thanksgiving plate should be at least fair to good. It wasn't and had me longing for the free Thanksgiving meals handed out at any decent church, because at least they would use a real turkey cooked that day. Instead, I got a plate full of sliced deli turkey that was salty and off-tasting, instant (from the box) mashed potatoes, a small [plastic] tin of cranberry sauce that had diced onions and jalapenos in it (disgusting), and some limp frozen vegetables. The food I saw other customers order looked sub-standard. The waitress who 'served' me was inexperienced and had a bad attitude as did seemingly the whole staff. It was my first time there, and needless to say I will not be going back to CB Potts, and I DO NOT RECOMMEND this place to anyone.
This place is pretty decent! It's not the best, but it's reliable. The food is good, and the beer is brewed on site!
Good beer
AMAZING
Food is fine.

formatted_address: 1415 West Elizabeth Street, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: The Crown Pub

reviews.text: Went here on a Friday night for cocktails around 9pm with several coworkers. The attitude we recieved from one of the servers was so bad that we left as soon as possible. We told the hostess we were there for drinks and she said to seat our selves anywhere (both bars were full). We went downtairs and proceeded to sit at a table. The server came up and said she wanted the table for people who were eating and not just buying drinks. I found this incredibly rude escpeically since we were told to sit anywhere and we would have gladly sat at the bar if there was space. This was also a HUGE mistake on her part because we had over $500 of old town gift cards to spend. We gladly took our money elsewhere. I even over heard her say to another server, 'they must not work in the service industry'. I worked in the industry for over ten years! I was so uncomfortable and offended I have no choice but to let this experience keep me from ever supporting this establishment again.
This is a very classy pub. Definitely reminds me of the pubs in the UK. Great food and service. Try the crispy ravioli!!
LOVE LOVE LOVE! A great Irish pub with some killer deals and great food!

I MAY give it another chance. Before heading to our New Belgium Brewery tour we stopped and had lunch here. This was only the second time I've been here seeing how I don't live anywhere near it. Overall the food was pretty good each time (burger was better than the ruben that seemed to be missing the kraut) atmosphere was typical pub but nothing special, and it was quiet enough to be able to have a normal conversation. The first time service went well, but the other day the server just didn't seem to care much. Only had us and one other table from what I saw, and spent most of the time standing at the front desk doing nothing. Not bad service since he did refill drinks and clear plates, but definitely seemed like he didn't care to be there.
Great local pub. They have great pub food and good beer list.

formatted_address: 134 South College Avenue, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: Black Bottle Brewery

reviews.text: The food is phenomenal! I tried the topped artichokes which were heavenly, I have never had anything like them before. The salad dressings are made in house and are excellent. Not to mention they have delicious beers on tap. The glasses are spotless and the staff is super friendly. I like that they only carry beers that are not normally distributed so you can try all different kinds of brewery beers. The names for their in house brews are very cute and clever as well. I will definitely be back.

formatted_address: 1611 South College Avenue 1605 & 1609, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: Vintages Wine

reviews.text: Amazing Experience! Best way to taste the wines you like and then have it handcrafted for your own consumption. Phenominal grapes from all over the World! We have wine in our private reserve that cost us about $10/btl and tastes like $70!!!

formatted_address: 120 West Olive Street, Fort Collins, CO, United States

name: Henry Hudson's
formatted_address: 2100 East 2nd Street, Edmond, OK, United States

name: Dan McGuinness Pub

reviews.text: This place is awesome! Wonderful atmosphere! I especially enjoy the smoke!
The waitress was a jerk.

The Irish food was OUTSTANDING but with saying that......even though it has a non-smoking section in the restaurant, the smoke filtered into that area from the bar area. We won't be going back because of that smoke! I guess after you get used to being in smoke free restaurants, you can't tolerate the smoke anymore. Being a non-smoker....it was awful. Still food was wonderful & staff was outstanding. Wish they could fix the smoke problem! I understand the smokers love the bar area, sorry.

We love to eat here but like another review the smoke is unbearable. I love the Irish atmosphere but we do not go here as often as we would like to due to the smoke. We like the TV's at each table. Can eat and watch our show. Staff is usually friendly. PLEASE get better control over the smoke in the non-smoking eating area~~~ :o) We love the fish and chips and fried covered in malted vinegar! True irish flare hard to find this far West!!! I am from Baltimore and these places are everywhere there, hard find in OK.
Deluxe nachos are the bomb! The whole food menu is great and cheap. Drinks are a little pricey, no shots under $5.00.... But the staff is great and very friendly!

formatted_address: 3005 South Broadway, Edmond, OK, United States

name: Laughing Sun Brewing Co.
formatted_address: 107 North 5th Street, Bismarck, ND, United States

name: The Walrus Restaurant

reviews.text: Always bad service, food good usually. Have been there more than once when NO ONE ever came to my table for service. Other times sat with other tables loaded with dirty dishes. WTH, guys

I really enjoyed this restaurant located in a very plain strip mall. I had heard good things about this restaurant at my hotel, so I decided to check it out. Upon arriving, by the look of the outside, I was not to excited. But upon entering, I decided it was a good choice. They had a great selection of micro brewed beers and imports and the menu was extensive. I had a Big Sky Moose Drool beer and the walleye. Both were very good. I decided to have the tiramisu dessert and it was excellent. I thought its too good to be true for this nice but sports grill type place to have dessert like this. The waitress, Shiela E was excellent. She was very cordial and helpful. I would highly recommend this place to visitors as well as locals.

We went here hearing about their amazing beer selection with over 40 beers on tap, we got there and they had only 20ish on tap and all of them were just the common beers you see everywhere (a place we used to frequent had over 100 beers on tap, sadly Bismarck is not known for it's beer selection). They even have a selection of "microbrews" consisting of 'microbrews' from Coors, Miller, and Anheuser-Busch. We had to ask them what they meant by microbrews (being the beer-snobs we are, ha) and they gave a very poor and incorrect answer of what a microbrew is. The food also was over-hyped, getting food that tasted like something we could whip up at home and paying a premium for it there. Overall the food was sub par and a very poor beer selection means we will never be frequenting this place again.

Best beer selection in town! 64 different bottled brews and a constant rotating excellent tap selection. There is no Bud Light or other huge commercial beer on tap. You will find that in the bottle. This is Bismarck so no they do not have 100 + taps cause it wouldn't work in this town. Having 20 taps is about perfect to keep your beer fresh. Staff is very knowledgable on their beer and food. Fantastic home made pizzas! Excellent service! I am there at least 2 times a week! Love them!
The food is better than average. I really like their wraps! Super beer selection. They carry one of my favorites! They occassionally have live music in the summer which is fun to attend.

formatted_address: 1136 North 3rd Street, Bismarck, ND, United States

name: Dan McGuinness Pub

reviews.text: I read the reviews here, before visiting Dan McGinnuss Pub, so I knew what to expect -- and was not surprised. Walking up to the building, I noticed some letters were missing from their sign, and there was no activity to be seen from the outside -- I honestly wondered if they were closed... Upon entering the building, I saw a few people seated at one table, but no hostess, and no hostess stand. There was no sign to let me know if I was supposed to seat myself. So, I walked into the bar... The bar just reaked of cigarette smoke. I saw a bartender, and two patrons. I turned around and left the bar, and walked back into the restaurant area. I saw someone entering something into one of the computers, so I asked her if I should sit anywhere -- she said yes... She came to the table immediately, and asked if I wanted something to drink -- I said, "Iced tea and fish & chips." (After reading the previous reviews, I knew to take advantage of the fact that the waitress was at my table right then!) She came back with the tea pretty quickly, but then never returned to refill the glass. Uncool, but totally expected based on previous reviews. The cook delivered the fish & chips to the table -- he looked a bit dirty, grungy, sweaty, and was not in the best of moods... The fish and chips were both so hot out of the fryer that I couldn't even touch them -- I consider this GREAT. The fries (or "chips") were good, and had some good seasoning on them. Yet there was some grease on the plate and over time the fries soaked up this grease -- so I didn't finish the fries. The fish was excellent. My first piece was a bit overcooked, but the other two were perfect. The breading was crispy and had good flavor -- though there was just a little too much breading, and I couldn't eat it all (so I just ate the fish and left the breading). I've eaten in real pubs in London, and I can say this was about the closest experience you can get to the real thing. Other "pubs" I've been to in the states are much too commercialized and focused on making the customer happy -- that is just not true of a REAL PUB. So, while the service wasn't the best, the food was good, and I liked the thought that I could have actually been in the UK for that meal. :) I will return.

I tried it multiple times. I just don't think you can give a low rating off of just one experience. My visits have ranged from weekend out with friends to solo lunches. But I must say this place deserves the lowest of low ratings. I have never been treated worse in my life. I have extensive experience in the restaurant business. I have done everything from wash dishes as a 16 year old to GM for major chains as a young adult. I am glad to say I no longer have to work in the food service industry. I was in my early 30s when I finally moved on. I have the utmost respect for everyone who does it and to this day have many great lifelong friends from my experiences in the industry. Most people don't understand what is involved. That being said I can say that I have never been treated worse on multiple occasions. On my last visit and I mean my very last visit ever, I was literally offended by the attitudes and lack of service from everyone on the staff! I felt as if I was an unwanted annoyance. I am not even a high maintenance guest. I don't special order anything and don't mind if things aren't perfect. In fact I don't have any problem with any of the food or beverages from Dan McGuinness. This review is directly aimed at its front of house staff. It was as if I was interrupting their social events as an unwanted guest.
Service is very dependent upon who your waitress is. There are several that are amazing which makes it worse when you get ones that aren't.

This pub has two atmospheres to enjoy. On one side it is a quaint wooden decor with nice booths that have their own television if you care to watch the game or catch up on the news while you eat. They have a good selection of traditional Irish foods and again excellent service. On the other side it has more of a bar and night lounge kind of a feel. This gives you two selections of where you want to go and good service has a lot to do with choice. Congratulations for producing a place that allows this to happen Dan McGuiness.
Probably a good bar, not a good place to eat. Went on a Friday night and the waitresses didn't even look our way. After ten minutes sitting at a table, we left.

formatted_address: 1003 Southwest 19th Street, Moore, OK, United States

name: Barbara's First & Deli

reviews.text: This is a great place. Only open for lunch but, they have many options. A hot entree, dessert and salad special each day. Salads and sandwich menu daily which all taste delicious. It is really fast and great for dine-in or to go.

friendly people, good food (and i'm fairly picky), nice ambiance, reasonable prices, good portions......easy parking right out front...... an old friend and i met for lunch there....enjoyed it very much....one of the staff was even willing to stop what she was doing and snap some photos for us

As is my pattern, I reviewed the online menu before heading to First & Deli for lunch. The online menu indicated that all sandwiches had mayo and I made a mental note (I simply cannot stomach mayo). Of course, I forgot though when ordering - the overhead sign certainly did not indicate the mayo either though. Realizing my mistake a minute too late (my sandwich was complete), I turned to my mom and told her I had forgotten to ask for no mayo. It was almost one o'clock so not very busy and all of the servers heard me, although pretended not to. So my mom asked if indeed there was mayo on the sandwiches. She was shot a dirty look with a snarky reply that there was a mayo spread on the sandwiches. I wasn't going to press the issue, so we just kind of stood there waiting for my mom's sandwich looking rather non-plussed. Finally the sandwich artist snapped to get the sandwich back, proceeded to take off the bread and wipe down my sandwich with a paper towel and hand it back (not well either) - so I had to pull of all of my fixings (mayo just makes me ill) and ended up with an extremely overpriced piece of cheese on bread. Needless to say - not only will I never visit First & Deli again, but I will also advise all I know against dining there as well!
Stopped here for coffee and dessert after doing a google search for "Best Desserts" in Fargo. Very friendly staff and the cookies are amazing!

This is a great little place for lunch, though it can get kinda busy. If you're looking for more than a sandwich, soup and desserts, this is the place. Not much more than that. The staff is friendly and the food is decent. Don't expect too much. (Which may be a good thing).

formatted_address: 520 1st Avenue North, Fargo, ND, United States

name: Fargo Brewing Co
formatted_address: 1003 Broadway, Fargo, ND, United States

name: Shadows Pub & Grill

reviews.text: Front desk girl was doing nothing but trying to secretly text in a drawer at the podium. Not helping much including seating people. Manager talked about like a space cadet, never once talking to anyone, just walking and staring at people. Waiteress had no clue how to take an order or keep drinks coming as requested since we had to wait on a refill forever. Food was good thought if you can get past their service.
Had a blast!!! We had burgers and steaks both were awesome.

formatted_address: 115 West 15th Street, Cheyenne, WY, United States

name: Freedom's Edge Brewing Co.

reviews.text: My absolute favorite pub in Cheyenne. Beautiful place, great beer, awesome people. Love love love it!!

While visiting my Sister and her family, who are stationed at F.E. Warren AFB, we decided to try out this microbrewery. We were not disappointed. Freedom's Edge is family owned and operated and is located in a historic building in downtown Cheyenne. The decor is set up like an upscale parlor/saloon and the clientele was a good mix of folks. Their beers are all delicious; my Sister and I sampled them all and couldn't decide which one we liked the best. The service was friendly and the prices were reasonable. They even provide a 15% discount for active duty military! If I ever make it back to Cheyenne again, I will definitely be making another visit.

Love love, Loooove this place. The prices are incredible, they put immaculate work onto renovations, spotless, chill place with a nice upscale feel to it. I was even amazed about the bathrooms, I wiped down the counter so that I wouldn&#39;t mess it up :). Smoking: If you choose to, they even have convenient outside ashtray. The beer is amazing, everything about this place is excellent. See you there soon :)
BEST PLACE EVER!!! BEER IS GREAT!! BUILDING IS GREAT!!! SERVICE IS GREAT!!! A PLUS PLUS PLUS PLUS!!!!!!

formatted_address: 301 West 16th Street, Cheyenne, WY, United States

name: Snake River Pub & Grill

reviews.text: Always a good time at Shadow's! Whether you are meeting friends for happy hour, or grabbing lunch with co-workers the food, atmosphere and service is amazing!

This place is great the food is prepared fresh. The historic location only adds to the decor. The prices for the portions are great. My favorite foods would have to be the pizzas, the fett. Alfredo. And the burgers. But all of the food is to die for. The staff has a fun but professional appeal. Over all the place is great for a bite to eat.

Service is very slow and sloppy. Server was slow, did not pay attention to us or check back, food was not warm enough. We waited far too long for him to take our card and cash us out. Was not busy either. (kitchen did a great job, food was great) Food is pretty good though. Firehouse burger is really good!
I found this place on accident, but I'm so glad I did! Definitely a local's place to be. Good atmosphere, and excellent balance of a fun pub and restaurant.
Only 2 beers avail at a brewery? and the one I had was terrible. The food was edible, but limited selection and pricey for what you get (there are much better $10-12 burgers).

formatted_address: 115 w 15th St, Cheyenne, WY, United States

name: The Egg & I

reviews.text: I thought it was a lil local restaurant. It had that feel to it. It wasn't until months later I realized it was a chain. The atmosphere is cute reminds me of grandmas kitchen and the staff is always friendly!

Shut it down. The walls are moving! No one has cleaned the walls in the kitchen in years. No one wearing gloves while handing my food. Also I sow the staff eating over my food. I think this place is a health hazard. Also I tried to get a receipt for my meal and it took 30 minutes to print. I talked to the owner and he's didn't want to address the problems.
Excellent food. Aversion of pun intended. A little expensive - that's my only complaint.
Tasty omelets. Good value. Although its a chain it still feels local. I hope to go back
Over Priced

formatted_address: 2300 Carey Avenue, Cheyenne, WY, United States

name: Texas Roadhouse

reviews.text: Best food I've had in a long time! Our waitress was excellent and made sure we were taken care of. The food was great! We will be returning in the near future.
Everything about this location is GREAT! the best waitresses/waiters in town, one of the best steaks, and of course the delicious pre-meal bread. will go back many more times

Had a juicy, tender 12 oz ribeye with mashed potatoes and corn, fried pickles for appetizer. The pickles were really salty, though tasty. They also have a bucket of roasted in shell peanuts at your table, and really good dinner rolls with cinammon/honey butter. Lots of food in a fun environment. Wait staff could use a little training on service, but we may have had a new server. Great place, worth going off the beaten path if you're driving through.
Requested a fast meal, Kelly delivered food quickly and to perfection while recommending what to choose. Food was great and never expected to be able to get a rare prime rib at a chain.
Love that place been to various location across different states but same great food... Talk about standardisation. Awesome place, great athmosphere

formatted_address: 1931 Bluegrass Circle, Cheyenne, WY, United States

name: Cool Basil

reviews.text: Great atmosphere, I love the remodel. Fast service and fast food with a great lunch menu. I'm not big on spicy, but you can choose your heat and the food still tastes great!

The service and atmosphere were fine but I had the Pad Thai and there was a weird taste in the noodles. I don't know if they were overcooked or what but it was pretty disappointing. Also had the healthy rolls for an app and they were just blah. The best part of the meal was the Thai fortune cookie.
Best Thai/Chinese restaurant in Des Moines. Good for lunch/dinner/business lunch.
This is pretty good Thai place and probably one of the best you would find in Des Moines. A bit expensive but then there are not that many good options in the DSM metro area.

The food was good, and fairly priced and our waitress was prompt, courteous and helpful. The Pad Thai was deliciously well seasoned, and the Kua Kai was scrumptious as well. In terms of beverages, the Thai iced tea and Thai iced coffee were both interesting and tasty. It was quiet with the exception of two strange old men jabbering about cleaning drains, but they left soon after we arrived and the pleasant atmosphere was restored. Unique Thai fortune cookies represented the restaraunt well: interesting, very thai, and tasty. Highly reccomended.

formatted_address: 8801 University Avenue # 22, Clive, IA, United States

name: Hooters

reviews.text: Food was subpar for a Hooters... the breading was non existant on our wings and our service was mildly slow. It wasnt very busy for an end of Saturday night.

Hooters in West Des Moines has greatly improved the "atmosphere". We went out on Saturday night to watch the NCAA games and enjoy cold beer with some great Wings. The Wings were pretty good and although our waitress was not the most friendly, many of the other waitresses were very nice and stopped by to see how things were. We bought a calendar and the girls signed it for one of my employees....very nice! The girls have also changed their attire to a Catholic School Girl Skirt...very sexy...but I hope they don't totally get rid of the orange shorts. In general, the food was pretty good, the beer was cold (but the beer is also overpriced), and the waitresses were great! We will definitely go back!

Our server whose name I can't recall was excellent. That is the only highlight. The $16 buffalo platter myself and a friend shared was a joke: 3 drums, 3 wings, 5 shrimp, and 5 strips. The hostess refused to give out wait times since UFC was on. While waiting, the party next to us was asked if they'd be willing to share a table with us. They declined (which I don't blame them for), but somehow that sent our party of five to the bottom of the list. $2.75 for soda is a rip off. We obviously didn't go for a gourmet dinner, but there is no excuse for not being upfront with customers about the wait and then expecting them to share tables as if it is a prison or communal dining room. Four stars for our server...0 for the rest.

Have been going there with a friends for last few years, from groups of 3-4 to 10+ and never had a single problem, found all the girls to be nice and eager to help, always got the wigs and never had any that were bad, just one time did they miss up out ticket on pricing but changed it as soon as we asked,great place to go, will continue to go.thank u dsm hooters

I always seem to leave the WDM Hooters, and recently any Hooters, disappointed. The service is consistently poor and the food is below average. If I want wings I now head to somewhere like buffalo wild wings, the chicken coop or Jethro's. The wings at Hooters seem to have less and less meat on them. As far as service goes...last time I was there I met 5 friends after work. We all requested seperate bills when we ordered, so we didn't surprise our waitress. When the bill came of course it was 1 bill and not seperated. We asked if she could please split it she said ok and left to presumably split the bill. She came back with pens, a note pad and the 1 bill and asked us all to write our names and what we had because "since you didn't ask for a seperate bill when you ordered I have no idea who had what just write it down and I'll split it". We tried to refuse but she just said this was the only way. So we sat there and wrote out what we all had. This wasn't the first time we'd had service like this at the WDM Hooters either, this was just the icing on the cake. They're going to have to have $1 big beers for me to ever want to go back after that.

formatted_address: 1480 22nd Street, West Des Moines, IA, United States

name: Newportville Inn

reviews.text: The atmosphere of the restaurant is very quaint. The German food is wonderful!! The prices are very reasonable and the selection of beer is fantastic!! I highly recommend the Newportville Inn for the family or even a date.
Great beer selection, that rotates regularly, and the food is good as well.

Seemed the night we went they were out of everything ordered the steamed clams never tasted anything as salty an old must have sat under a heat lamp for an hour as that how long it took to get our meal.
Great food, clean and personable. Servers are pleasant and the chefs there rock the food.

Excellent German food, one of the best filet mignons we've ever had (and we've had quite a few), good beer selection (local micro brews and German), attentive service, reasonably priced. What more could you want?!?

formatted_address: 4120 Lower Road, Newportville, PA, United States

name: Neshaminy Creek Brewing Co
formatted_address: 909 Ray Avenue, Croydon, PA, United States

name: Union Brew House

reviews.text: Beer is awesome!
Best bar south of Boston passionate about their beer and great food. Dont miss out on this hidden gem A++
Great selection of beers. Need more seats and larger parking lot.
Best beer selection

formatted_address: 550 Washington Street, Weymouth, MA, United States

name: Landing Pub Inc
formatted_address: 2 Commercial Street, Braintree, MA, United States

name: Old Capitol Brew Works

reviews.text: Great beer. The Farmer Brown is my favorite. Laid back environment. Sweet patio!! Wonderful waitresses and bartenders provide great service. The local regulars make you feel very welcome too!!
You can get a 4 pack of 16oz cans for $8. 'Nuff said. Plus there's always cool dogs chillin on the patio.

Old Capitol Brew Works is a neat little bar in downtown Iowa City. I went in early on a Friday night before the college crowd really came out in force. I sat at the bar and asked for a Budweiser...they didn't have Budweiser so I got the House Light instead. It was pretty good. I then asked for a menu and ordered a burger. I had to pay extra for cheese and extra for fries. It took a little while to get my food, but that was alright cause I was watching a game on the big screen TV right in front of me. The burger came served on a roll...not a regular bun. Can't tell you what kind for sure, but it was pretty good. The fries that I paid another $1 for were nothing more than out-of-the bag crinkle cut fries. I wasn't very happy about this. If you're gonna charge extra, make some good fries. My feelings is that at $8.75, this meal was overpriced. There was really nothing special about anything other than the bun. I wasn't unhappy with my meal, but wasn't blown away either.
Love great river!
Last time I was in there, they were out of 4 different beers. Wont go back,

formatted_address: 525 South Gilbert Street, Iowa City, IA, United States

name: Pints

reviews.text: The bartenders are very rude and disrespectful. We had a bartender tell us to leave when we were already outside of the bar. Many other rude comments and service as well.
Best bar in iowa city. Amazing amount of TVs, good crowd of people. Amazing service. Sexy waitresses too!

formatted_address: 118 South Clinton Street, Iowa City, IA, United States

name: The Brown Bottle

reviews.text: Good food, expensive, boring atmosphere
Decent italian, kind of pricey.

I agree with Steve below. The food tasted fairly good but not worth the price. However in addition, now tonight,my girlfriend, I and her daughter all have upset stomachs after eating dinner there. The cutlery was dirty with bits of dried food on it, as was some of the serving dishes. The waitress was not welcoming and seemed arrogant and made us feel like our 4 year old daughter was a hassle. The food took a long time to come also, although I did see others getting served faster than us so maybe just our experience tonight, although doubt it. I'm giving this one star because of being sick after eating here combined with the lousy service.

I have been coming here for years and it just seems to get worse and worse. The food is good, just not really as good as the price would suggest. The people are consistently rude and seem to not really care about your experience or if you even come back. After my most recent visit ,where I couldn't sit outside due to a reservation an hour away, I doubt I will go back.

Used to come here years back when it was "the" place to go. Lot has changed. The restaurant seems shabby and not in a chic way but in a shabby, dirty, old worn out way. The food is just okay. My salad was full of brown lettuce. The waiter's response "sorry about that", but no offer to get another salad or comp part of the meal, maybe a free dessert?. We got our food in a timely manner and it tasted fine but not sure if it was worth what we paid for it. The service was fine. The ladies restroom was not clean--mold ring growing in the toilet (when was the last time it was cleaned?) and a suspicious brown substance all over the walls of the stall. Ugh. Dinner for two with tip was about $45. We will try someplace else next time.

formatted_address: 115 East Washington Street, Iowa City, IA, United States

name: Sanctuary Pub

reviews.text: Everything was fantastic. Food was perfect beer list was huge and the service was excellent. Ask for travis as a server he is hilarious, attentive, and very handsome. Best server i have ever had
This is a great bar with fine cuisine. The beer selection is composed of some of the best I've had. Every entree is delicious, I especially like the mussels.
Hands-down, best pizza in Iowa City. Awesome beer menu, great atmosphere, nice staff - and no TVs, which is super refreshing. Good cocktails too, including absinthe.

I love the atmosphere here, especially the dark wooden pews which are surprisingly comfy. Also their beer selection and pizza are amazing. I used to come regularly to see a jazz jam session which was always fun, and I think they still have concerts here, but they also have another room that's quieter and would be nice for a date. Having said that, it is pricey compared to other IC bars. But a lovely place for a quiet, atmospheric drink.

This is by far my favorite restaurant/bar in Iowa City, and is somewhat of a "Best Kept Secret", so I hope it stays that way after this review is written! Why this place is unbelievable, is the oak wood paneling, the HUMONGOUS beer and wine list, and also is also the fact that they put on some amazing concerts in one part of the building, and the other is like you're transported to some European gastropub! Simply, I've never had a liquor not stocked, or a drink unknown, simply because they seem too have everything, even absinthe(the kind with wormwood)!! My favorite drink there is this Brazilian Caipirinha, that is squeezed limes and sugar cane juice, nothing like rum, and oh so delicious! Try it with some veggie lasagna or a lamb slider if you're not afraid of meat! It'd be fitting if they had someone to look at passports at the front, because it definitely doesn't seem remotely like anything the states has to offer!!!

formatted_address: 405 South Gilbert Street, Iowa City, IA, United States

name: The Mill Restaurant

reviews.text: Entertainment generally outshines the food here, but it's good quality and fairly cheap.
Good shows. Nice atmosphere
Good food and a terrific venue for live music.
Decent place to eat, cozy atmosphere.

Worst experience I have ever had. We reserved a table a month in advance for my birthday and were treated horrible. The waitress with brown short hair is the worst. I would never ever recommend going back for this reason. Not only was she hostile to my face when I asked her where we were going to sit two of my friends (again we had reservations so it shouldn't have been difficult) the restaurant was freezing cold and only half of our dinner was good. If I didn't have a party that night I would have walked out. Hated it!

formatted_address: 120 East Burlington Street, Iowa City, IA, United States

name: John's Grocery Inc.

reviews.text: I guess old-fashioned neighbor-like service means "no" service. I was just in there and the guy in the wine department told another employee that he was bored and that there was nothing to do. All he was doing was sitting on a computer "not" helping me. I walked out without purchasing anything. If this is old fashioned service then it's time to step up to the new age where service is everything.

John's has the finest beer selection I have found outside Chicago, and perhaps the largest number of Belgian and German beers I have seen anywhere. The U.S. microbrews are perhaps a bit uneven; I'm partisan, of course, but I'm a bit startled to see so few small Wisconsin breweries represented. It should be noted that their wine room, though a good bit smaller than their beer rooms, is thoughtfully supplied. Even so, John's is probably not the place to go if you are looking for an obscure label. Lastly: John's is the only place in Iowa City with non-HFCS tonic water. That is smart.

It's where I go to get a quick bite for lunch to avoid the fast food or restaurants. they also do great snack trays for parties and showers. We use them for that rather than get the target desert trays.

There's nothing better than having a neighborhood grocery. Amazing selection of goods, terrific wines and beers at excellent prices, and everybody knows your name. When your husband's on the way to buy some wine you can even call John's and ask them to be sure he buys ice as well. What's not to love?

I have been ordering from John's grocery for many years and have not met a more personable or honest seller. He even sends personal e-mail information to me when items he thinks I may be interested in become available. I have never been disappointed and have not found lower prices. Thanks Jonathan! TNM store

formatted_address: 401 East Market Street, Iowa City, IA, United States

name: Vesta

reviews.text: This is an excellent food and drink place, classy

I had high hopes for this place...but it was not good...at all. I thought we lucked out passing by on the hwy and finding 'a diamond in the rough' instead of the normal road-trip fast food joints. HA. The food sounded good on the menu but I was sorely disappointed. I cant say that it was poor quality, it just had a really bad flavor. Dont come here, unless its just for a beer. The drink menu was decent.

We stopped here for dinner. Average salad. Salmon was fishy & dry. Crab cakes were not cooked enough on the inside yet burnt on the outside. Atmosphere was disappointing, had to listen to the bartender gossip to friends. Sorry would not go back here, it HAD so much potential.
Excellent food and atmosphere. I would definitely reccomend this place to anyone.
Great place to eat. Food is always cooked perfectly. Great wine selection. Servers are friendly and have great menu knowledge. Beautiful decor and romantic atmosphere.

formatted_address: 849 Quarry Road, Coralville, IA, United States

name: Old Chicago

reviews.text: Very good place to eat. Reasonable price wise. Good service

Love the Italian Nacho's. Been here 3-4 times, visited the ones in Wichita many times in the last few years. This place is a must every time we visit our kids in Cedar Rapids. Very good food and the service has always been great.
Great food, nice people. Good beer selection

Went here after spending a few days in uihc with my baby decided to get something other then hospital food. After telling me and my family (dad, our other two girls and myself)there would be a 15-20 min wait they attempted to seat us at a high top table by the bar...hello highchair?! After attempting to make human contact with our horribly rude server we waited an hour for food that just never came. They offered to give us our food for free and pack it to go....but still missed one of the orders. Manager offered us a $25 gift certificate that I declined. I'll never go back there even if its free. Thank you Old Chicago for making my first day out of the hospital a poor experience and for wasting precious time I could have spent with my baby at uihc. We took our food back to the Ronald McDonald House and tried to forget what an awful experience hour restaurant was.
waitress was VERY friendly.

formatted_address: 75 2nd Street, Coralville, IA, United States

name: Olde Main Brewing Company

reviews.text: Great beers. Good food. A bit pricey. Go on Wednesday for dollar draws, you won't be disappointed.
The beer is the main attraction. Everything is second to that. Their food is good, common, but good. Head down here and drink a pint or two, or ten and enjoy the atmosphere.
Pint night on Wednesdays is always a good time!

Dollar pint night is the only time I'll go. The foot is mediocre. The beers are hit or miss; they are inconsistent and their flavor changes every time that I'm there. Wish there was another microbrewery in Ames that could give them some competition.
The bartenders were great especially the blonde guy (really attentive) I had alot of fun and enjoyed all the food and beer

formatted_address: 316 Main Street, Ames, IA, United States

name: Brewer's

reviews.text: Brewer's is a cool, classy place to meet your friends and relax with some great drinks and appetizers. No more pricey than any other "nice" bar in the area and the staff is super friendly and accommodating. Not a sports bar, but there are a few TV's usually showing "the games". Overall laid back feel with a wide variety of ages represented. I also enjoy seeing live music there on the occasional weekend.
Great staff, friendy environment, classy, and delicious drinks and appetizers!!
Great atmosphere!

formatted_address: 2704 Stange Road, Ames, IA, United States

name: Old Chicago

reviews.text: Good for a bar but not a great restaurant. Service really sucks a lot of the time. Not very cheap either.

This place is a chain that is famous for 110 beers, many on tap, and the World Beer Tour. The bar area is great with a dark Irish Pub feel. Many big screen TV's and a fun atmospshere. The food is great and there is a nice variety as well. There is a separate dining area if you prefer that over the bar scene. They can get busy on game days but do a good job with service if you give them a chance. Join the Beer Tour and get in on the fun and prizes!
Love old chicago
Mediocre.

formatted_address: 1610 South Kellogg Avenue, Ames, IA, United States

name: Ames British Foods
formatted_address: 429 Douglas Avenue, Ames, IA, United States

name: JL Beers

reviews.text: We were excited to try this new place ... we walked in the door everything was going great. They changed the channel on the huge flat screens so we could watch the hockey game. As we opened the menu the night got better cheep food, the waitress walked by and the serving size looked ample. Then the bartender approached... what would u like to drink? We said water... his reply we don't serve water... we sat for a second, looked at each other stood up and walked out the door. Grand Forks water is better then average, and they lost 2 customers and any potential for our recommendations. Sam Salwei

formatted_address: 2531 South Columbia Road, Grand Forks, ND, United States

name: Green Mill Restaurant

reviews.text: All in all... okay. Not great, not bad. It's kind of hit and miss. Do really enjoy their Desert Fire Pasta.
Good food but pricey
Had to get my own menus. Lunch portions are child-sized. Pasta was very oily with a film. Had vegetarian options which is a plus. Had to ask for water refill and for included bread. Mediocre at best.

I had a gross meal here once and got a free meal out of it, so I could give them a second chance. Well, they blew their second chance. The food taste gross again and the service was bad. I will never eat their again! It's sad because this seems to be a reoccurring thing among restaurants in Grand Forks.
Great food, average for a Green Mill restaurant. The service is sometimes very bad. I have been forgotten by servers at this restaurant a number of times.

formatted_address: 1930 South Columbia Road, Grand Forks, ND, United States

name: Coach's Bar and Grill

reviews.text: I tried to love this restaurant/brewery, I love their own brewed beer. But, their service and inconvenience to their customers draws the last straw. Great food and drinks or not, if you're not available to treat repeating customers with respect, you're spreading a bad reputation. Congratulations, you have lost my business.
Great place to hang out and watch games. Fun atmosphere and best prices.
Great food and atmosphere. Order the LINEBACKER EXTREME pizza, my favorite.
Food is good. Love the pizza and their own brewed beer. Service leaves a lot to be desired.
Nice place to meet a friend or two to catch the game.

formatted_address: 102 West Main Street, Norman, OK, United States

name: Library Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Nice neighborhood bar. Not the best beer selection, but good enough to keep me coming back!
Good selection of beers at a reasonable price. Great happy hour specials.

The Library is hands down my favorite bar in Norman. It's a great place to sit down and chat with friends. I love the patio because it's sheltered from the street by trees and well-kept landscaping. The happy hour and drink specials can't be beat, and the food is great. I recommend the pizzas, nachos, salads and quesadillas. Seriously, they have the best nachos in town! Service is super friendly and hospitable. The beer selection is among the best around and there's always something new for me to try. I love this place!
I love this bar, but the service at tables has always left something to be desired. The secret is to order your next round when you get your current one.

Some of the worst service around. The waitress will have about 6 tables and will still only manage to make it to you about once an hour. This is not even an exaggeration. Whenever my friends drag me there we just order 3 beers at once, since you won't see her again for at least 45 minutes, if not longer. I've been there a lot but I'm finally sick of it. They also take your driver's license at the beginning and you always have to go track them down if you want it back and if you want to pay your tab. Unless you don't mind waiting the 45 minutes for her to come back and then another 30 minutes for her to bring back your change, then I suggest going elsewhere.

formatted_address: 607 West Boyd Street, Norman, OK, United States

name: Martha's Exchange

reviews.text: Sweet Shoppe is Great Too! I purchased a spring basket with assorted chocolates for a client of mine. They absolutely loved it! The price was fair and it just looked really high end. If you are looking for a gift that is unique and will sure make a lasting impression, check out their selection! Amazing!
Love the food here. Great service. Once they were late in bringing in the order. They gave us free soup and did not charge for one sandwich. Good choice of their own brewed beers
Great selection of beers. Home away from home.
great place to go for some night life

Beer: 10 out of 10. As a microbrewery, the brew some very tasty beers. Food: Drink dinner and you'll be fine. Otherwise the food is bland, tasteless, and overly salty. Service: On a good day, you'll get barely adequate service. Most of the time, the wait staff acts like they are doing you a favor. Atmosphere: On a warm summer night, there is no rival in Nashua to sitting outside, drinking some great beer, and people watching. If you want a good beer, and can put up with the hit or miss (mostly miss) service, go to Martha's. If you want a good meal or good service, go elsewhere.

formatted_address: 185 Main Street, Nashua, NH, United States

name: Jasper's Homebrew & Winemaking

reviews.text: Very helpful owner/staff. Plenty of beer selection and plenty of recipes if you are brewing your own.

formatted_address: 4 Temple Street, Nashua, NH, United States

name: Ambacht LLC

reviews.text: Stopped by after work and had a nice chat with the owner/brewer. The place is a production brewery, so don't expect a brewpub experience but it was fun to have a poke around and sample some of their upcoming beers. Beers are good too, i guess I should add.

formatted_address: 1055 Northeast 25th Avenue, Hillsboro, OR, United States

name: Big Bear Brewing Co

reviews.text: Excellent food - had the Turkey Meatloaf with Gravy and Cranberry Chutney and Garlic Smashed Potatoes. 14 bucks. For an appetizer we fought over the delicious Honey Mustard dip for the chicken tenders. 13 bucks. Also, the Homemade Root Beer was delicious.
I was impressed. Must go back will try the brunch tomorrow
Great Brie appetizer, everthing else on the menu is great as well. Great ambiance!!Specialty in house brewery! You can't go wrong here!!

The beer is very tasty and the service was great. The food was just ok but priced very high. Too high for us to make a return trip. The cooks need to realize that a little is enough. Food swimming in sauces is just not appetizing. Five feet of onion rings looks nice but by the time you get to the bottom, they're soggy and gross. Cut the prices as you cut the portions, easy on the add-ons and keep the food simple. That strategy MIGHT bring me back.
I have been going here for years. Love the Brewer and the Cheese Soup. Alway s consistently good.

formatted_address: 1800 North University Drive, Coral Springs, FL, United States

name: Miller's Ale House-Coral Springs

reviews.text: High quality food, great dialy specials, good beer prices; service can be a bit slow when crowded. The Ale Hse is a favorite meal stop for me.
The place smells old and the dust on the walls and on top of seat backs and dirt makes you wonder how the kitchen looks .
Never go there. Little nerdy guy blaring crappy music while idiots play trivia between songs. Thought my ears were going to bleed. Guys voice is like nails on a chalk board.

Oh my gosh I have such mixed feelings about this place. It's loud but that's the kind of place its supposed to be. They have a great bar business and the crowd is usually on the young side the later in the evening it is. Good party place... it's an Ale House. Usually it's not too loud though and it's open late which is why I go there. Food is ok for the most part not great but its good bar fare and their wing sauce is yummy and they have an awesome ice cream pie desert. I almost always get their pan sauteed mahi picata which is more like a lemon butter franciase. If Kenny's in the kitchen it's always good and it's served on a bed of fresh spinach with steamed broccoli. The DJ issue is another story. Depending on the manager on duty... who is the person I blame, it can be overly loud and the music choices can be offensive to some and are not meant to be heard by children. And there were children present. I hope that's all been dealt with. Otherwise service has always been good... so if you are looking for a late night spot when your hungry this beats the hell out of Denny's.

The main good thing there are the chicken tender mountain melts. The rest is a little overpriced but it's good to watch games and relax....but then your butt hurts cause the chairs are wooden flat benches. Overall it's ok. It's really crowded but good dj.

formatted_address: 1915 North University Drive, Coral Springs, FL, United States

name: Boscos Social Club

reviews.text: Bartenders are very nice. I love the outdoor patio for playing bags and hacky sack in the summertime. Thats my summer bar. in the winter i dont go much on the weekends because it gets ridiculous packed, but its not their fault really. theyre a successful bar. great place to go
Always a great night out at boscos.

The atmosphere of this place is awesome. My friends and I always enjoy ourselves here. I don't know of any other place like it in or near Waukesha other than hauling all the way to Milwaukee around Brady Street or the Third Ward. The drinks are good, and is a nice, trendy spot to sit back and enjoy a drink, then walk down to Rays on South for a bite to eat or to the Civic Theatre to watch a show (exactly what we did Saturday).

formatted_address: 260 West Main Street, Waukesha, WI, United States

name: Arbor Brewing Co.

reviews.text: Food was all right but not worth the price. I ordered salmon with seasonable veggies and mashed potatoes, but it ended up being literally a mountain of potatoes, a couple pieces of broccoli and an all right portion of salmon. A restaurant that serves you a mound of potatoes seems lazy to me. You can go to much better places in AA for the same price and get amazing food.
Cheap beer and good drunk food. Beware the hipster wait staff. Their apathy towards life does not translate well into good service.

Ive been here a ton, I will say the service can be inconsistent; most places in a college town will get that though. I would recommend the German Alt 22 if you are a Beer lover. their IPA is great too.

Excellent local Michigan brewery, with many good beers on tap. Really good food provided by attentive wait staff. I just about always stop in for a pint or two when in Ann Arbor, and often make this my prime destination.

I didn't spend much time inside as it was beautiful outside so I took my beer outside. The staff was great at they had a few beers on staff. I have had beer from this company before but never at the brewery. It was great! Very good quality!

formatted_address: 114 East Washington Street, Ann Arbor, MI, United States

name: Grizzly Peak Brewing Company

reviews.text: My friends and I have been regulars at Grizzly Peak for 8 or so years now and the most impressive aspect of Peak is how consintently good the beer, food, and service has been. Year after year the standards have stayed high and I do not doubt this will continue for years to come.

My beautiful date and I tried the 9 beer sampler first... I normally drink Bud Light. I was very impressed! Then we ordered the Calamari, which I had never had, and now I am hooked! My date did inform me it was the BEST she ever had! Then we order the fresh mussels, in the red sauce, and once again PERFECTION! We also shared the Kobe Sandwich...WOW! YUM! thats all I am gonna say! We ended the night with the portabella and spinach pizza. And let me say it was honestly the best pizza I have ever had. The saddest part was we didnt leave room for dessert! I was AMAZED when I received the bill and it was UNDER 50 BUCKS! Amazing night with an amazing woman....CANNOT WAIT TO GO BACK!
Food was amazing! Watermelon bbq wings were surprisingly good. Our server, Jeremy, was really nice. Overall great experience. Definitely coming back.
Our waitress came to our table and instead of greeting us said "what do you want?" Not impressed with the service at all
The food was absolutely delicious and our server, Jeremy, was amazing. So amazing I'm half in love with the man. I've never had a more attentive server in my life.

formatted_address: 120 West Washington Street, Ann Arbor, MI, United States

name: Jolly Pumpkin Cafe & Brewery

reviews.text: REALLY delicious for a great price. I can't speak for the beer here (under 21), but the food is fantastic. It's a little expensive but very much worth it. On top of that, our waitress was friendly and the environment is fun. Great decorations. Definitely one of the better restaurants in Ann Arbor!

Festive bar area downstairs, quiet and roomy dining area upstairs. The staff was very helpful when I couldn't decide which cider I wanted to try. Large beer list (this place is also a brewery). The truffle oil fries are worth a try and the pizza's are enough for 2.

One of my favorite places to eat in Ann Arbor. The pizzas and sandwiches are excellent, there's a wide variety of esoteric beer styles, and the truffle fries are deadly. I'm never disappointed. During the summer the open air deck is a nice touch, too.

Really looking forward to Jolly Pumpkin for the Spring. Starting this spring, they'll be getting all of their produce and bread from White Lotus Farms - an amazing organic (but not organic certified because certification is a huge hassle) farm on west liberty.

my favorite Brewery in A2. Great beer (you have to try the one which tastes like vine - it's called like Rioja or so), pizzas are great, so is the meet and starters. interesting cocktails and snack plates. always full on weekends though!

formatted_address: 311 South Main Street, Ann Arbor, MI, United States

name: The Beer Depot

reviews.text: I don't know what these other people are whining about. Great place, for good beer selection. The staff is not there to comfort you, but they do their job

I live around the corner from this place and will not be shopping here again. Their pricing on beer is like that of a kid who robbed his parent's stash and is selling at school. I can admit they have a fairly decent selection, but I could easily find a bigger selection and lower prices by hopping in my car and driving only a few minutes. I could also get better customer service out of a vending machine. The people behind the counter here are more concerned with goofing off with their friends and random juvenile horseplay than paying attention to anyone in their store. On top of it all, used port-o-potties at the State Fair are cleaner. Their ONLY redeeming quality is the above average selection. After that? The pricing is terrible, the service is awful, and the cleanliness of the place makes me want a quarantined decontamination shower when I leave.

Smelly, dirty, seedy characters hanging around. Other than that they seem to have a fairly large selection of beer, wine, and liquor. The home brew supply section could use some work. They have some useful things, but I wonder about the freshness of their ingredients. I think some of that grain has been there a loooong time. I think they are gonna have some fierce competition with the new Adventures In Homebrewing opening up on Jackson Road.

Short opinion: Could be better. The store appears to be limited by size. See body for more. Drink: They have a decent selection of liquors and beers and wine, however other stores have a wider selection than the Beer Depot. With the restricted floorspace they're limited to what they offer. Homebrew: Still the only store in Ann Arbor to carry brewing equipment. The selection does seem to be spotty, with equipment and supply that are occasionally empty. They do however carry a wide range of grains for small scale brewing, including extracts for gluten free brewing. They also have a range of hops and yeast, however much of it may be stored in the back rather than in the front display case. I've seen better supply stores when I lived somewhere else, but it's not a bad place to get supplies when the only other option is either online, or a much further drive. If you have any questions about the homebrewing equipment, materials and prices, you *need* to talk to the brewmaster. He will be the only one who knows the differences between products and prices, as well as where to locate them. He also has his own recipes that he's created including gluten free beer. The other staff members unfortunately don't know about the equipment. As with any liquor-only, or mostly liquor-only store in michigan, you're not looking at elegant display settings or up to date fixtures. They do however have eclectic selections of meads and beers. Overall opinion: I've been in and out of the store browsing over the past few years and I prefer whole foods and meijer for my wine. (Although I usually get it from the wineries before either of those options.) What I like is having a nearby place that has homebrewing equipment and supplies, with at least one staff member knowledgable in this area, and hope that they can maintain this area, including wine brewing (which they looked to be selling off their kits at this time). I would certainly prefer if they could expand their selection and modernize the inventory tracking and clean up the entire building, but I'll keep going back to them.

Went in. No prices for their keg-orator components. 'employees' were more interested in having a good time with friends who were visiting. Told to call back (when there was someone who had a clue). Called back. Told they don't know the prices. Can't order anything other than what is being displayed (no prices displayed). Then got a quick 'okay thanks' and hung up on me. Don't even bother with this dump. No matter how far you have to drive, you save time and money than trying to deal with these clowns.

formatted_address: 114 East William Street, Ann Arbor, MI, United States

name: Wolverine State Brewing Co

reviews.text: You gotta love this place. Remember, it's a tap room, not a full service restaurant. There are no wait staff or food. Just a bar keep and a "menu of menus" to order food delivery. However, their chips and peanut are so cheap ($1) and generous, I often ask for a half order. Oh yeah, the beer is awesome!
Tap room with great atmosphere and excellent house beers. No food, though, so grab a hot dog from the stand outside or a Little Caesar's from across the street to bring.
Great place to meet and talk about a construction project and enjoy a pint of IPA.
Good beer.
Best on the west side. Great place for a pitcher, or six, of beer

formatted_address: 2019 West Stadium Boulevard, Ann Arbor, MI, United States

name: Fraser's Pub

reviews.text: Great place to meet with friends, have great food and good people
Nice!!!

It's the Classic Ann Arbor pub. The great place to be for the local exposure to U of M sports. Plenty of great times there for U of M football games. Always a good crowd enjoying each others company. Staff provides very good service and has fun doing it. Did I mention the good food?!!

I agree that their fries are good. I had one of their special burgers that are seasoned, which was also pretty good. Our waitress was really nice and friendly, and the environment was not as dark as I anticipated from reading others' reviews (it's as dark as a romantic restaurant). I went on a Sunday night and there were about 15 other people; the atmosphere was very relaxed and you could tell people were genuinely enjoying their time there. Note: Their pizza kitchen is CLOSED permanently.
Friday Lunch Time - Great Service - 1/4 burger - onion rings - coke + tip = $17 - food just ok = value sucks....

formatted_address: 2045 Packard Street, Ann Arbor, MI, United States

name: Blue Tractor BBQ & Brewery

reviews.text: Not really a BBQ place. More of a brew pub that has BBQ. I had the sampler and I am not a fan of wet ribs but I tried them and I if you don't like sweet don't get them. They also used a very heavy beer mop sauce on them that overpowered the meat at most times. The pulled pork was probably the best thing on the plate. The brisket is well cooked but very light on the smoke for my taste. The Cheddar grits were OK. I was not a fan of the balsamic baked beans. The two flavors clashed and I did not care for it. The 3 cheese mac was mediocre at best and not a $6 side. I had higher hopes for this place when I walked in but was left wondering why did we eat here.
I love the Blue Tractor! Miss their wonderful tomato soup they recently took off the menu, but other than that I wouldn't change anything! Great food, friendly atmosphere, good service.

First and foremost, best beer out of all the local AA micropubs. Good staples and pretty frequent rotating ones as well. I've only ever gotten sandwiches, but pork, chicken, cuban, burger all were great for me. Curly frees are awesome as well.

By far my favorite restaurant in Ann Arbor. I have visited Blue Tractor a lot over my time at U of M and this was always a top destination for many students as well as Ann Arbor locals. Go with a group and order a bunch of different plates so you can try all that they have to offer. The beer sampler is very popular and the mug club is a fun purchase if you're local as it gives you great deals for every visit. I highly recommend the pulled pork macaroni and cheese- awesome combination, the bison burger, the smoked chicken and corn soup, and the sliders combo. Their menu has changed recently to what a server described as more "upscale" barbeque, and unfortunately some of these may be no longer regularly served, but I still stand by the review. A must visit in Ann Arbor!
Great beer, great food, great happy hour. Interior may be the coolest in ann arbor. If you like BBQ you will enjoy this place.

formatted_address: 207 E Washington St, Ann Arbor, MI, United States

name: Salem Beer Works

reviews.text: Used to be better, I have no idea why they changed their menu and decreased portion sizes. I don't think I will go here again. My favorite double order of buffalo shrimp is gone. Beer good and interior is nice too.
The employees are so pleasant. Nice atmosphere. I left with a great impression of the place and service. I will def go again.

I went in around 11:30 on a Tuesday night for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. The hostess had a good attitude, as did the servers. I sat at the bar and ordered a Greek salad with grilled chicken and a tall watermelon beer. It wasn't out super fast, but the bartender (Dan) was very friendly and funny, making it go by quickly. When I got my salad, I noticed that the fresh basil was missing (only because I f*ing love basil) and the manager (Casey) brought out a big side of it and apologized. They played all music that I like (they can choose it on slow nights, but weekends they likely have to play pop radio stuff). The food is a tiny bit expensive but not grossly overpriced like the Tavern, and anyway the beer was practically underpriced. Bottom line is that I'll definitely be returning here in the near future.
The scallop poor boys were awesome. Three with each one including two massive scallops

I hate to give this place only 2 stars because the beer is VERY good. The food, ick, not even edible. I gave this place 3 chances (as I usually do) and each time it was worse and worse. The last time what the last time I will ever eat here again. I ordered the meat loaf, the tables food came out and mine was missing, they forget to put it in (ok mistakes happen). Four minutes later (no joke) my plate comes out and there is like 1/4 inch of water in the place with my food sitting in it. It was like everything was frozen and they just nuked it. They did get me something else but there was there was not genuine apology or money taken off the bill for the two mix ups. If you want to just drink, like I said the beer is good. May I suggest mixing the pumpkin head with the cider....oh yea parking is a pain.

formatted_address: 278 Derby Street, Salem, MA, United States
